description:
REOPENED AFTER RENOVATION!!! 

Fast and tasty neighborhood treat! Looking better than ever after renovation, and the food is still #1! My roommate and I definitely missed Buffalo Burger! 

Try it Out!
author: Nick C.

description: Wings and burgers are a must. Fresh and juicy th.  Nice friendly staff and a neighborhood gem. Great burgers and nice small restaurant.
author: Andrew M.

description: Solid lunch spot! Ordered a bbq chicken burger with everything- lettuce, tomato, pickles, purple onions ($7.25) and side of French fries ($2.50). Chicken size was kind of thin and not too much bbq sauce, which is good because I don't want a soggy bun. Very friendly and fast delivery of food. Even during Friday lunch there seems to be spots to sit, although a bit cramped. I'd come back to try the fish and chips.
author: Thomas L.

description: Wings are great-burgers are great and so is the service. Been coming here for years. Highly recommend!
author: Matthew S.

description: Found this place by mistake. A lot of options. We ordered completely different things and they were equally amazing.
author: Brittany Z.

description:
Came here to try their pastrami and cheese sandwich, but it turns out they ran out.. & there's a minimum $10 for credit/debit.

Instead, I settled and tried their infamous wings. I got the 6 bbq wings  that came with celery, carrots and ranch. I also ordered a side of chips. This came out to a little less than $10 and the guy was nice enough to let me charge it on my card.

The bbq wings were just okay, there was not much meat on my drumstick or wing and the bbq sauce barely stuck on. It was just mediocre. 
On the other hand, the side of chips was tasty! Thinly cut potato slices fried are actually pretty good if you are craving chips instead of fries.
author: Jenny S.

description:
I love buffalo burger!! Me and my boyfriend come here a lot for wings and fries/onion rings. 
Everything here is super good. I love getting the Cesar  salad too usually. The people that work here are great and are always super friendly to us!
author: JR E.

description: Fast simple and tasty burgers. Great fries and coleslaw. Fish and vegetarian options also available.
author: Greg P.

description: A no frills basic burger/wing/sub shop, this place is one of my old reliable go to spots whenever Im in the outer richmond. They finally reopened after renovating and the new interior looks nice. As far as the food its still good as I remember. The wings are crispy and well sauced and the burgers are solid. Now this isn't the spot for fancy food but for the prices its a good value. The service here is always friendly and it really feels like a neighborhood joint.
author: Peter P.

description: Super over rated!  Maybe because I worked across the street for a year.  Small burgers and sandwiches.  Tried most of the menu and was never thinking wow!  That was great!  I mean it's not bad, but nothing special at all.  Go to lous sandwiches down street.
author: Ryan K.

description: Here's the thing: if you're hanging out in the Richmond and you want a bite to eat that won't make you broke as a joke, as well as some fried goods to soothe those craves then this is the place for your face
author: Yasmin K.

description:
We used to live a couple blocks away, and it was definitely our go-to burger spot.  The same (hard working) man takes our order, regardless of the time or day of the week.  Orders always come out perfectly, even with substitutions.  

The food is consistently great!  We've had the hot wings, beef burgers, turkey burgers, fish and chips, chicken strips and (plenty of) french fry variations - and we love them all.  Everything is made to order, so yeah, you have to wait a few minutes for FRESHER food.  

We've since moved 20 blocks away, but when we return to the neighborhood for other errands, we almost always choose to eat here.  Thank you Buffalo Burger! :)
author: Marisa R.

description: One of the best local burger places I've had. Quality food. Great service. Owner brought the food to our table and made sure we were doing ok. The garlic fries are so delicious they remind me of the ball park fries.
author: Suzan L.

description: According to a Buffalo phone recording, starting from March 7, this joint will be closed for 2 weeks for renovation.
author: Yvon Y.

description: The best Burgers in S.F. The onion rings garlic fries and our burgers are definitely worth writing about . BUT i was also so impressed with the fast friendly service . I was visiting for medical reasons , and the cashier woman seeing that i was recovering from a surgery , ontop of being super sweet , she went above and beyond to help me and bring everything to ur table took our second order at our table brought me change . . I WILL definitely Be back . Its my new fav spot in S.F OH and i guess they remodeled recently and it looks super fresh and Nice and clean
author: Christien B.

description: I ordered a 2pc. fish and fries take out order brought it home to eat. It runs $8.95 including tax. Still delicious but somehow I remember the fish fillet being meatier, it was mostly batter around a skimpy piece of fish flesh. The size of the fish fillets has really shrunk or maybe it was only my two pieces that were skimpy? Compared to some other yelp photos , I would hv to say I got the skinny ones ,also they were a tad over fried imo. Fries were good and crispy tho. But still okay around the Richmond neighborhood.
author: Grace P.

description:
I decided to try Buffalo Burger because its in the neighborhood and the reviews are good. I'm not sure whether it was just an off day for them or what but I really wasn't impressed with the food I received. 

I ordered their "ultimate burger", which is a cheese burger with avocado and bacon, and they served it to me on *white sandwich bread*. Did they run out of burger buns? I don't know, but when I got home and opened my takeout bag there it was, all the fixings of an ultimate burger: patty, cheese, lettuce, tomato, onions, bacon, avocado, and condiments sandwiched between two slices of what looked to me like wonderbread. 

White bread is much more thin and weak than a bun and accordingly the sandwich was soggy and within the first or second bite the whole "burger" just completely fell apart. Clearly there's a reason burgers are usually served on a bun: burgers are too greasy for sandwich bread.

I'm guessing they just ran out of buns that day or something, but they should have at least told me and not just thrown together a burger on sandwich bread. The burger in their pictures is definitely on a sesame bun. What happened with my burger? 

Ordered garlic fries with the burger which were also very soggy. Soggy "burger" on white bread plus a soggy little bag of garlic fries made for a pretty disappointing meal.
author: Tomas K.

description: Pretty well priced. The fries are fresh cut. Decent burgers and fried fish. The place is now closed but I hope they reopen soon and without the usual dramatic price gouge.
author: Jeff W.

description: Gotta love Buffalo Burger on Geary! Their 26 piece hot wings are the bomb, and allot closer the O.G. Buffalo Wings on Lombard. Burgers are good, as well as the Shrimp. I always go back here for Sat night take-out and movie night!
author: Enoch K.

description:
Lazy Sundays. That's what happened on September 13th. The roommate and I ordered delivery for dinner through DoorDash. We ordered around 5:45pm and our food arrived around 7pm.

*Bacon & mushroom burger: 6 oz of choice ground beef, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, pickles, ketchup, mustard & mayonnaise served on a toasted sesame seed bun ($5.95), add Cheddar cheese (+$0.95)
*Ultimate burger: bacon, avocado, grilled onions & 3 kinds of cheese served on a toasted bun ($7.50), add Thousand island dressing
*Buffalo wings: served with crispy celery, carrot sticks and creamy bleu cheese dip - Lemon pepper & Extra Spicy ($5.50 per order of 6 wings)
*2 pieces fish: served with tartar sauce and fries ($6.95)
*Caesar salad: romaine hearts tossed in caesar dressing sprinkled with parmesan cheese, no croutons ($6.95 large)
*Garlic fries ($2.50 small)

The burger meat and toppings were good, but their buns are huge! It threw off the bun to meat ratio for the roommate. I didn't care as I didn't eat the bun, but get ready for a bready burger! The wings could have been a little meatier, but they were okay. The extra spicy ones weren't very spicy and the lemon pepper ones didn't have much flavor. And they were rather oily. My favorite part of this dish were the carrots and celery. Fresh and crunchy! The fish and chips were pretty good. Nice and crispy. And so were the garlic fries. The salad was pretty average.

It took us a while to remember that we also ordered a Chili cheese dog ($4.95) which was missing. I reported it to DoorDash and they gave me $5.38 in credit. No harm, no foul as we had ordered more than enough food anyways.

Pretty standard joint for burgers and such. It fulfilled my burger craving, but I probably wouldn't order from them again. Nothing about the meal really stood out.
author: Elena N.

description: Decided to go here to get my wings for the Super Bowl this year. Very underrated wings spot here in the city. Definitely one of the best. I ordered 100 wings the night before and they were hot and ready for pick up come 3 o'clock.
author: Mike N.

description:
If you want a reliable burger joint that serves you up a juicy patty, look no further.

Buffalo Burger is nestled near 17th Avenue on Geary and boasts a large selection of burgers, from bacon avocado to Philly cheese steaks. The food is typically cooked on the grills in the back, and you can hear it sizzling while you wait. The meat is always piping hot, juicy, and tender, while the other ingredients are always fresh. Never had a bad food experience here. They've got a ton of condiments to choose from as well, its good news for fans of Worcestershire sauce!

The joint is pretty small and can certainly get pretty cramped, but the food is worth it. Great place to indulge in a burger for lunch or dinner. The cashier can be a jerk sometimes which is a bit off-putting, but once you get past him, the rest is golden.

Be sure to try the garlic fries and banana shake if you can!
author: George K.

description: Food and experience is amazing found d this place and the menu looks amazing, got the bacon avocado burger and 6 wings and they are so bomb. Definitely will come back here for more next time I'm in the city
author: Edward B.

description: Solid quick burger spot with a lot of other options.  Buffalo wings are one of my favorites here.
author: Avery N.

description: Pretty damn good burger. It tastes like it was cooked on an actual grill, as opposed to flavored as such. Such perfectly crafted burgers on a great bun, served with what I can only describe as perfect "chips" because these fries are just large enough to go beyond our normal French fries. So friggin tasty.
author: Justin S.

description: I like this little place! Great wings, good prices, and the guys who work their are super friendly. They also secretly have great sandwiches! I had the buffalo chicken sandwich and the chicken was tender, the roll was soft and delicious. Oh, and I LOVE the buffalo chips!
author: Goldie B.

description: My go-to place when I'm craving a burger or chicken sandwich. The supreme chicken sandwich is my favorite! Very tasty and the grilled chicken is very tender. Their spicy buffalo and lemon pepper wings are also delicious. Staff are always friendly and welcoming.
author: Madeline Q.

description:
This might be my favorite fast food place in SF. Usually, I don't go out of my way for fast food. This place is the exception. 

They have a pretty decent size menu with several options to choose from. Burgers, shrimps, sandwiches, saladas, fries... you name it!

I have tried their burger. Which is fine. Better than most fast food places. But their burgers just fade in comparison to the true stars of the show: fried shrimp, garlic fries, and buffalo wings. I also order their greek salad as a way of atonement for my fast food sins. But I regret nothing. Nor should you.
author: Andréia S.

description:
This place is as good as it gets. The hamburger is the equal of any I've had here in the City and at a much more reasonable price. You get a burger the quality of, say  Burgermeister 
for about the price of a Whopper. the only  difference between this and the upscale choice 
is the bun, which is fine for what it is, but a sourdough or whole wheat bun (or choice) would be a plus. I consider this place the best deal in the City- at least for burgers. They are so good that I've been eating here for 17 years and I've yet to order anything else (other than the buffalo wings, which are equally good). The fries are steak fries, home made, skin on and a small order is so big that I've yet to finish one when ordered with a burger. Any time I've taken a friend we've split an order and both of us were full. A totally huge bang for your buck!
author: Eric M.

description:
I've been to this place several times as my office is just across the street.  I'm a sucker for fish and chips and this place has decent sized fish fried well without too much oil left over.  

In addition, I am a fan of the garlic fries.  They are liberally seasoned with their garlic mixture and evenly tossed for good coverage.  I've gone a couple times during the work week just for an order of to-go garlic fries to bring back to my office.  My boss may not enjoy the smell, but that's why we have windows.
author: V. Y.

description:
The french fries here are awesome, they taste fresh cut, which I think they are, but could also just be awsome frozen fries (as Rascal's in So Cal has).

The burgers here are okay, nothing spectacular, but not fast food styled either.

They cook 'em to order, (so you can get a more juicy medium rare burger).

The meat patty itself isn't necessarily huge, but is fair in proportion to the pricing.

The buns are fresh and big (a bit too big for me in my personal preference of a bun/bread to burger/meat ratio).

The fish & chips (we opted for the fries, as they were out of chips the day I visited) were good, 'tho the fish are small seemingly frozen fish sticks (not chopped and formed style, but similar to what you'd get at Costco or from the frozen food isle in a Gorton's Fisherman brand box at the supermarket).  But, nonetheless were good, moist and tasty.

The service was very friendly and courteous. 

Parking in the Sunset District is always a slight challenge, and the meters of course are always a bit expensive, so if you have good parking karma and a little bit of luck plus perfect timing, you can usually find something in the adjacent neighborhood for unlimited street parking.
author: Rick S.

description:
On a recent trip to SF I decided to stop into Buffalo Burger. I used to live in SF, and I frequented an amazing Buffalo wing place as a kid. I don't remember the name of it, but I loved it... and the sign above the restaurant reminded me of that old restaurant so I chose to give this place a try.

The menu had quite a few options on it. You can get wings (of course), burgers, hot dogs, fries, and a few other various items. In the mood for wings, I went for the spicy Buffalo wings and the lemon pepper.

I love my Buffalo wings when they have a great tangy taste. It can be spicy and hot, which is fine, but there has to be that unique tang associated with Buffalo wings. These wings were definitely tasty, but were just slightly lacking in what I wanted from a Buffalo wing. 

The lemon pepper wings were on par with the Buffalo wings - they were pretty good, but not great. I wanted a little more intensity in both of these wings.

So while I did enjoy the meal, I wanted just a little more from this restaurant.

I did like the size of the chicken wings. They are on the smaller size... but that was perfect. Some places use a gigantic steroidal chicken with huge meaty parts. I'm not a fan of that. Now, I don't know what kind of chickens this place uses, but I think they wing size is perfect.

I also ordered some fresh chips to go along with my wings. The restaurant of my childhood offered fresh chips as well, so I had to get these. The chips here were very good, and I enjoyed them very much. It seems like the fries here get some very mixed reviews... just go for the chips!

The pricing at Buffalo Burger is good, and it beats many of the chain wing restaurants in this area.

Would I come back to Buffalo Burger? If I were in the area and was in the mood for some wings... yes... I would. It's a good restaurant that delivers good food for a good price.
author: Luke C.

description:
I went into Buffalo restaurant this evening to order 13 chicken wings three fish and chips. I got it all to go.The wings were nicely spicy, and not all lumpy and gross.  The fries were not soggy when i took them home. The fish were pretty good? I wish the fish batter has been a little fresher but it was still not bad.
That whole meal cost $20:12, not bad for a full meal with lots of fresh carrots and celery.
author: Paula M.

description: Small place to hang at a continent location. The burgers are a bit dry and bread is not toasted. Take a good 20 minutes for the food to make. Occasional interruption by incoming customers. Reasonable price at 5.25$ or add 2.25 for buffalo meat. Chicken wings and veggies sticks are pretty standard. Lunch okay.
author: Vincent Manjin L.

description:
Good burger.  One of the few places I have seen offering a Buffalo burger in California, so if Buffalo is your thing then it's a great place to go to. 

The only problem I came across was that I ordered, and the guy at the cash register charged me 2 dollars extra.  This may have been a mistake though.  Other than that good place.
author: George P.

description: Best hamburger joint in town! I drive half way across town to sink my teeth into one of the juiciest, and tastiest burgers I've had - ever. Really good food, friendly service ((from obviously very hard working staff) even when super-busy)), and decent pricing. I've even told the manager/owner that he should raise the prices. The only down side, is they don't have a beer/wine license.
author: James M.

description: Good food, but terrible service. I asked the guy who worked there if the bag on the counter was our food, but he slapped my hand away and told us not to touch it. He ended up giving the bag to a man who just came in (we came in about five minutes before him), and who was obviously his friend. I am amazed at how rude he was.
author: Rachel M.

description:
I wish I had taken a picture of my burger - but I ate it too fast.

Mushroom burger with swiss cheese and thousand island -- one of the best burgers I have ever had.

I ordered delivery through DoorDash and was very pleased with the flavor of this burger. Honestly, I really can't say enough good things about it.

The fries were good as were the fried mozzarella sticks. The only way the mozzarella sticks could have been better was if they came with a side of marinara instead of ranch dressing. When did ranch dressing become the de facto dip for everything.  Although I did end up using it for my fries. :-)

I will order from this place again and will definitely stop in the next time I am in the neighborhood.
author: Wendy P.

description: This is our go to place when we want good burgers and awesome chips! My fave has always been the blue cheese or Hawaiin teriyaki burger. The oysters are just ok. Pretty small but I grew up eating oysters & chips from the pier 39 & navy pier so I'm picky with that. We've tried the patty melt and a few other burgers and they never seem to disappoint:) we've always ordered ahead of time and just picked it since it just a few blocks near our house. So i can't say anything about eating in.
author: lala d.

description:
I came in early around 11am and no one was there.  Service was prompt & friendly. It only took 10 minutes for me to get my order of:

BBQ WINGS:  the 6  wings were on the small side but at least you know they don't use steroids.  The wings were flooded with this faintly spicy bbq sauce accompanied with  a cool white dip with carrots & celery pieces to cool your palate. Grade=A-

ULTIMATE BURGER:The burger was cooked completely, juicy with grilled onions, avocado, cheeses.  I didn't think the bread roll was that fresh, but overall, a good burger for this low price. Grade= B

GARLIC FRIES:  The fries were greasy, but I could really TASTE the garlic on the fries.  Other places just pay lip service and sprinkle dried powdered OLD garlic on top, but here, at least the garlic fries were not that far off from the fries at At&T Park. Grade=A-

CHOCOLATE MALT: I really liked the chocolate malt, haven't had one in a very loooong time.  Grade=A

I have to agree with everybody else that the pricing at Buffalo's is pretty darned good compared to other restaurants in the area.

Buffalo's is a small restaurant (i wouldn't bring more than 1 to 2 people with me) although if you come early as a group around 11am especially weekdays, they can FOR SURE accommodate you. You can also take your food to go.  They accept CC.

Would I come back?  For  sure!! I VALUE my money and the more "bang for my buck" I can get from a decent restaurant/eatery, then the better I like it, especially in the expensive Richmond district!!
author: Frugal C.

description:
I HAVE NEVER EVERRRRRR HAD SERVICE THIS BAD! 

I wanted to know how small is a small order of fries and BONNY, the guy taking my order, shrugged his shoulder and rudely said "I don't know." In my mind I was thinking what do you mean you don't know, don't you work here? Even if you didn't know you should have a way to find out like show me the container it's served in. So I decided to ask him if he can show me the container they served it in. He rolled his eyes, let out a big sigh and went to grab the bag it's served in. After receiving that kind of attitude from him, I told him "Nevermind, I don't want to order from here anymore" and walked out. Guess what this guy did next?! He waved bye to me! ARE YOU SERIOUS?! 

Never ever coming here again. Yelp really needs to start letting us give places 0 stars because giving Buffalo Burger 1 star is soooo much more than they ever deserve.
author: Michelle T.

description: Ordered 50 wings for pick up at 3pm and called 3 hours ahead. Showed up at 3:10 and wings were not done and they said two more orders are ahead of me.
author: Jonathan Q.

description:
The only reason I won't give this place 5-stars was because the person working was pretty impersonal to the point of being boarder line rude. I walked out telling my friends that I'll probably come back again because their food was that good but the worker was a major turn off. 

They're pretty decently priced. They have a restroom. They have a wide variety of food options. I got their wings and they were great (they don't have boneless wings). 

My friend also ordered some cheese fries and they were spot on. I'll go back for the cheese fries any day!
author: Jenelle G.

description:
Ive had lots of good experiences considering I come here atleast once or twice a month and that my school also volunteering place is nearby as well. Id say this is the best burger place. Ive been to for a good price.

Nice cashier, good spacing between tables, clean, has a tv to watch news or sport games, good food!!!!

I had the patty melt once, it was really
Good but doesnt beat the turkey burger that I always get! The patties are freshly made same with the fries. Im not a big fan of fresh chips so I always get garlic fries. Always leaves a smell on me,  but its always satisfies me:)

Only thing I dont like is when me or my friends ask the owner for ketchup in cups. He gives this stingy face that makes me unhappy about this place. The cashier is nice, but this only happens when we ask the owner. Its kinda inconvenient theres no where to dip your fries unless you drizzle it all over the fries which i dont like to do. Other than that, this place is good for lunch, dinner, or when youre craving a burger while youre in the richmond district.
author: Josie D.

description: Fast and easy burger joint. Grilled chicken sandwiches too. Fries, onion rings and potato chips to compliment your burger. Inexpensive!
author: Debbie C.

description:
Let me get this straight - a cow works out a few too many times at 24HF then hops in a tanning bed for too long, and it mighty morphs into a buffalo? Somebody text Darwin and tell him he had it all wrong. Other than being leaner, drier, and costing over 50% more, I couldn't tell the difference between the buffalo and the beef burgers I've eaten.

3 1/2 stars. 4 for their reliable taste & convenience and because I'm down to go here any day of the week. 3 for their ordinarity and because I'm down to go here any day of the week.
author: Dan B.

description:
Buffalo Burger is a little gem. The owner is sweet as apple pie, the staff is warm & friendly which makes for a very pleasant dinning experience. 
They have lots of options which can be great if you have a group who is feeling different options. I enjoyed the teriyaki chicken without veggies. They prepare the chicken to order which is just mouth watering and pleasantly filling. 
My sweetheart for a turkey burger ala teriyaki burger style with a side of their delicious homemade chips.
If your in the mood to have a meal that is hand to heart made with Love, drop by Buffalo Burger... You will be pleased and satisfied :)
author: Rebecky L.

description:
I reaaaally wanted to like this place because it was so close to my apartment and it's a small business. So I went in and ordered a philly cheese steak to go. So I get the sandwich and am about to eat it at home when I see a short black hair, UUUUGH! 

So like I said, I wanted to like this place but once I see hair, my gag reflex kicks in. I will not be back to try anything else out.
author: Yvonne T.

description: The food was great. My wife and I were walking by and wanted to try this place.  My wife got the Philly Cheese Chicken and I got the Crispy Chicken Ranch Sandwich.  We both loved our sandwiches and we will be coming back again.
author: Himesh P.

description:
I really like this place!  I've been three times, and tried three different things (even though I'm vegetarian!).  The fries are amazing, a small size is actually pretty large, and you can tell they make them fresh because you can see the bucket full of fries soaking in water in the cooler.  Perfect amount of soft and crispy. Plus, malt vinegar! 

The first time I tried the grilled cheese. Admittedly, I was a little underwhelmed.  Bread-to-cheese ratio was a little off.  The next time was Christmas Eve, and in this part of town everything had just shut down at about 9pm. I called, on the off chance they were open, and the guy who answered said he'd make my order if I ordered right then. Two veggie burgers, two fries.  Walked on down, and I felt so bad because clearly they were already closed. (Lights out, chairs on tables).  I was sooo happy he made my order for me, because he didn't have to.  The veggie burger is just a gardenburger I think, but at $5 or so each, the price is right.  Just now ordered the veggie philly cheese.  So good. Perfectly sauteed tofu, veggies, and cheese on a soft roll.  Perfect fries again.  I kind of hope the word doesn't get out because the prices are so low, it's almost unbelievable!
author: Sara R.

description:
Wife and I were hungry for a hamburger someplace different. She went online and found this place that looked decent, but the prices were too low. What the hell -- we decided to try it anyway because the "health inspection" score was so high. All that either of us ordered was  a hamburger with mushrooms and although they could have used a few more mushrooms, considering the low price, we were both shocked by how good these burgers were! Everything tasted very fresh and excellent quality. In this town, I can easily pay double the amount (I have) for a burger that won't be as good. So I'll be back. The place was clean and the guy at the counter was exceptionally nice. Excellent hamburger at low price in clean, pleasant surroundings. What more can you ask for?

Looking at some of the reviews below, I can see complaints about some horrible person that used to man the counter. They've probably been fired by now.
author: Gary S.

description:
There is something really satisfying and comforting about a good, old fashioned burger... and Buffalo Burger is making some of the best around.  There is nothing fancy or gourmet about this place, they are just making delicious traditional burgers at a good price and executed to perfection.

THE ORDER - http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/FEvO7R8w1BDTUp_WibR7NQ/l.jpg

Ultimate Burger with a Buffalo Patty - 4.5 out of 5 - Buffalo meat patty with bacon, avocado, grilled onions, 3 kinds of cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, ketchup, and mayonnaise on a super soft roll.  Wow old school burgers really don't get much better than this!!  The Buffalo itself was well cooked and perfectly seasoned.  It is balanced well with the other ingredients.  The avocado is great and works well with the smoke and saltiness of the bacon.  The grilled onions are great as well.  I ended up really taking my time with the burger, enjoying each and every single bit.  I really haven't had a no frills burger this good in a LONG time.  Much better than Bullshead on West Portal.

Garlic Fries - 4 out of 5 - French fries are thick... not quite steak fries but more than regular ones.  They have a very nice crisp to them, probably twice fried.  There is a good amount of garlic topping on them (I actually wouldn't have minded a little more, but I LOVE garlic).  Very well done and it really just felt so "San Francisco."

OVERALL

Wonderful experience!  It's the best Buffalo burger I've had thus far.  I really can't wait to come again.
author: Rob P.

description: I ordered a burger and it dropped on the floor but it wasn't my fault and asked if they could've made a new one for me. But they were unprofessional and couldn't even give me a burger
author: Martin L.

description: I tried the Buffalo Wings (mild) and the chicken teriyaki  rice bowl. The wings were spicier than I would have liked for mild (low spice tolerance) but still good. The rice bowl was okay, but I recommend leaving out the veggies as they're not good veggies. The veggies are non traditional rice bowl staples in my opinion.
author: Adamme K.

description:
This place has one of the best burgers in town. Great quality meat, fresh veggies and much like me, a great bun. 

What I really like about their burger is the perfect ratio of meat to bun to veggies to condiments. It's a really well balanced burger.

The menu is big, so there is a little something for everyone. Although if you come and don't get a burger then you will be missing out. Wings are a great side addition here. 

Get the homemade chips instead of the fries. Don't get me wrong, the fries are not bad at all, but the homemade chips will make you question your sexuality. 

The owner is friendly and almost always working the counter.

So go try this Richmond District staple and get one the best burgers in SF.
author: Adam N.

description:
" Meh I've experienced better " really hits it on the spot.

Eating a really late lunch on a Saturday afternoon, this was the backup plan since sushi places aren't open till 5pm. Came in, stared at the menu for a bit and placed our orders.

Philly Cheesesteak; no bell peppers - It looked so yummy. (And when does philly cheesesteak not sound delicious?) I took a bit into it and was thoroughly confused. The meat was fairly soggy or soaked in juices that wasn't some sort of dripping oil.. a couple bites later I wanted to order something else.. but wasting 3/4 of a sandwich is terrible. I'm not sure what they cook their philly cheesesteaks in but this tasted like TERIYAKI sauce. if you're not going WTH then I will for you.

Spicy Teriyaki Wings - My tongue got assaulted :( We asked for ranch and got blue cheese; which i really just don't like. and my cheesesteak tasted more Teriyaki than the wings

Fish Stick Sandwich - My friend said it was good ( +1 )

Maybe i'll stick to burgers next time but I won't be back for a while. My stomach and tongue might boycott food all together after this experience.
author: Jenn Y.

description:
I walked in and was immediately greeted by the cashier. I placed my order - Chicken Tenders with Garlic Fries (what they're known for and for $.50 extra) he cashier asked me for my name for the order and then proceeded to ask me how my day was; to be honest, I was having a shitty day so the cashier just asking me about my day made me a bit fuzzy, so I dropped in a dollar for the tip jar. 

Unfortunately, this good service was short-lived. When receiving my food, there was a miscommunication about what sauce I asked for when ordering (I thought I said BBQ, and was given Buffalo) but it was so petty I didn't mind paying an $.50. But then looked at my fries, and turns out it was regular fries when I ordered it with Garlic so the cashier decided it was okay to not charge me for the $.50 BBQ sauce.

The chicken tenders were really yummy and had a lot of chicken too - 3 normal but thick pieces cut in half, so 6 were present. The garlic fries though were all sorts of inconsistent - some were okay while others were cooked too long(so biting into them was dry, hard and took about one and a half second to eat since it was really hard), cooked too short, etc. The garlic after eating the whole my meal left a terrible after taste that you can't get rid of until much much later.

I threw about 2/3 of my fries away. And not sure how to feel, but the other table had a little girl with her two parents(I'm just assuming) and was given ice cream for free  (that's sweet of the staff but made me feel a bit left out, perhaps maybe should've waited until a left to do that sort of stuff and maybe would've made more sense to provide me some since I was only given "free" but not really free BBQ sauce and forgot my order too) 

Perhaps I had given my tip too early - and lesson learned - wait until after my meal to dispense into the tip jar.
author: Yeanne L.

description:
They really only get a star because the staff was nice. Otherwise it was very disappointing. 

The person saying this place has "one of the best burgers in town" must be on something because that is not even close to a true statement. A double double animal style at In-and-out has more flavor. 

I also got the garlic fries and the were lacking in flavor as well as not being fresh. 

I was really hoping that this place would surprise me but it left me not wanting to finish my meal.
author: Tyler T.

description: Me and my friends were craving burgers and found this place by Yelp. When we arrived we weren't sure if it was the right place for its appearance but were starving so decided to go in.  Best decision of the day! Great variety and awesome garlic fries and the people working there were super nice all the time
author: Ale E.

description:
Good homestyle food. Kinda greasy but still delicious. It's pretty cheap so I don't feel guilty ordering anything off the menu. Although.. i do feel guilty for my waistline, haha! They have salads though.. I just prefer getting the deep fried fish and french fries..and burgers.. and chicken wings! yumm.. :P

This is an order at the corner and receive your food sorta deal. Although the person working there brought our food over instead of calling our name on the receipt so that is nice. You have to throw your own trash away although I saw some people leave their trash on the table. Shame on you!!!! 

Oh yeah, there's a bunch of sauce on the tables.. like malt vinegar, tabasco, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce..

The food is nothing spectacular, but still good.. it's perfect for a low-key sorta night..you know, where you're too lazy to cook but still need to get food, and don't want anything too crazy.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Best burger and fries on Geary. U can upgrade to buffalo for 2.50. What makes this place stand out from the others.. U can put malt vinegar on our damn fries!!!!! The way it should be all u stupid ketchup people. Yes!!!
author: Satoshi K.

description:
Best fries in the neighborhood!

The burgers are great too.  The menu has everything you could want (especially if you're hungover).  The prices are reasonable, the service is fast and the food is pretty darn delicious.  

I am a huge fan of the Avocado Burger or the Fish and Chips.  It's been a while since I've had the wings, but if I remember correctly, they're pretty fantastic as well.
author: Lisa R.

description:
I was so excited to eat here again after about 17 years. I used to live down the street but I happened to be nearby for work on Saturday afternoon and wanted to take my associate for a nice treat. Neither of us had eaten all day so we were pretty hungry. We both got vanilla milkshakes. He ordered a chili burger. I used to love getting the fish & chips, decided to change it up and got a seafood combo with fish, prawn, oysters and scallops (my favorite!) The thick-cut sliced potatoes fried up crispy were super amazing. Then I took a bite of a scallop! It was extra firm and tasted a bit funny but since I hadn't been in so long, I thought maybe it was a seasoning they used. We had to get back on the road so I took most of my order to-go and ate the rest of my delicious meal while we were driving. A couple hours later, my belly was full of gas and I was burping up foul sulphur nastiness which continued well into the next day. I don't know what exactly caused my body to react that way but I suspect a scallop a few days past its prime. :( I wanted to alert the staff in case more people had the scallops so I tried calling but the mailbox is full. One less star for my negative experience. 
I hope to visit again before the next 17 years. Thanks for keeping the Richmond delicious.
author: Michelle M.

description: What it lacks in atmosphere it makes up for in price and deliciousness.  Best fish and chips in the entire city, and a total bargain.  The other food I have ordered is also great - fresh, custom ordered, and delightful.  One of my go-to's in this neighborhood.
author: Emmett L.

description:
Really great cheese steak for under $ 7. Go for it!

The burgers are good too, especially for the price.

The fries are ok and worth it if you are craving the deep friedness. 

I like this place a lot and so will you.
author: Justin S.

description: Why is this place not getting 5 stars? I have been coming here for years. Not only are all the ingredients SUPER fresh, but it is SO cheap! I mean, under $5 for a burger?! I only eat turkey burgers and they are not dry and have great flavor! My husband gets beef and loves them too. Their fresh cut fries usually don't make it home when I do takeout. You can call ahead to place your order too. We do go to fancy burger places too because we don't live near Buffalo Burger, but it usually leaves me feeling like I paid too much for something that wasn't nearly as great. Ok, now I am hungry.
author: Kat M.

description: The food is sooo good here! So many options, I went with the crispy ranch chicken sandwich and it was amazing. My boyfriend had the double cheeseburger which was also very good. I'd like to go back and try the Philly Cheesesteak and mozzarella sticks as those looked very tasty.
author: Alyssa Z.

description:
3.5 stars.

Nothing fancy by any means but this joint is open late (til 10pm), relatively clean, and everything on their menu (burgers, cheesesteaks, and fish and chips) is around $5-10 bucks. Perfect for bargain bites when you're on that B.O.B. status, you know - Ballin' On a Budget. 

Ordered the patty melt - $6. It's a little different since there was ketchup but the beef had surprisingly good flavor. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Nvc1XZVJZhp2CHbh_hTLUw?select=-1kdrIpt0qSUu1SSrTuerw)

Plus, is there such thing as bad buffalo wings? There's only better.  These are better than Hooters but not as good as Wingstop's and I like how they came with a bunch of carrots and celery. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Nvc1XZVJZhp2CHbh_hTLUw?select=jtVzcF6pTMDy1CxuPg1YeA)

Solid spot for late night bargain bite eats if you're not feeling Jack in the Crack or Video Cafe.
author: Earl G.

description: Ordered fish n chip w/ fries and Spicy BBQ Buffalo Wings. The food was great.  Really tasty home cooked style. Wings are really,  really good.
author: Garren ..

description:
After so many times of walking by this establishment me and my friends finally decided to try it out.

There was nothing that made the burgers taste special. The girls working at the cash register asked to take our order and even thought I specified 'No tomato' there was tomatos on my burger.

Anyways, I ordered bacon avocado and these descriptions sum up my experience: the meat pattie was very dry, the bacon was burnt and the avocado was not fresh. I know when you put avocado with hot food it won't look as fresh, but my avocado didn't even look green.

I might give this place another chance just because I know that its a family owned business.
author: Oriel F.

description: With all the great reviews this place has , I decided to give it chance while visiting sf I was very disappointed.The burger didn't have flavor and the wings tasted as if they had been sitting there too long . The tables were all messy ! Immediately  after I felt my stomach cramping up, then I got nauseas and here I am not able to eat! Food poisoning is what I got. Def won't be returning
author: Luna S.

description: Food is great .. I usually order fish and chips .. Their fries is pretty good ... The person took my order is not very friendly the two times I went there the person didn't even smile I think person works to much but food is great.....
author: Muktar B.

description:
AMAZING Garlic fries. so garlicky, so perfect. 

The burgers (and actually all the food) are so cheap, it's awesome. The burgers were under 5 if you wanted beef, added a couple of bucks for buffalo meat. Solid burger, couldn't really ask for more!
author: Christine U.

description: The food looked fine to eat but the quality and timing was terrible. It took them 30 mins to make plain sandwich.
author: Sophia O.

description:
I would give this place a 3.5, but my friend says 3, so our average rounds down to 3.  The burgers are tasty and the sandwiches delicious, but the french fries were a little thick for my liking.  

Bottom line: I was not wowed. If you are walking by and looking for a good ol' burger, this is the place for you.  It is not a place to seek out.
author: Jessyca M.

description:
First the only bad thing about this restaurant:

FRIES

I dont know what they are doing wrong but they have a taste of old tea bags. That is really disgusting. I made a lot of times the mistake to order the fries in the hope that they will get better but... no. Always this disgusting tea bag taste. Terrible. Maybe something is wrong with the oil? I dont know, please improve. In that case i could give you 5 stars because:

The service is great.
The burgers are really awesome and so are the chicken wings. (but think about a napkin otherwise it will be a delicious mess ;) ;) )

Great restaurant! With good fries it would be worth for 5 stars in this price category :D
Best wishes
author: Marco T.

description:
HELLUH YUM HERE


Philly Cheese Steak Sandwich that was off the chain along with a side order of their garlic fries.  Solid combination fashow.  The dude working there was nice, greeted us once we got in.  I already knew what I wanted so proceeded to order.  Didn't take too long for the food to come and they bring it right up to your table. I thought it was a nice touch.


All I saw was the meat, peppers, and cheese spilling out the sides of my sandwich, in the bestest of ways of course, and then.. I saw a fork and was like hales yeahhh. I had to eat everything that fell off the sides, that's what the fork was intended for right? They already know wassup.


Garlic fries were pretty decent too, just wished I had a COUPLE more. Other than that, no complaints. Will def be back for round dos.
author: Annie C.

description:
Out of the blue....I had no clue....Buffalo Burger.....
Quick....with the help of Yelp.....
What can I say?  Was it finger licking good or what.....
So....burgers....my cravings at the time...
Just had to try it....

Ok....The Ultimate Burger with some Fresh Cut Chips and a Soda please.

The Ultimate Burger came with 3 kinds of cheese, letuce, tomatos, onions, alvacado and bacon on a french roll.  Lots of stuff in a burger....um....ok....but just ok and not the best....but good for being a $6.95 burger....because it had all the extras....with the cheap price I'd bumb it up half a star from 3.

Fresh Cuts Chips.....Ohhh....eat this first!!  Best when eaten hot!!  Fresh cut Chips......they make their own chips here.  Nicely fried, yet tasty...not too thick, not too thin....chips are fried just right....the slightly thicker ones especially gave you more of a potato .....something different, something tasty.  Get the Ranch Dip / Sauce (50 cents extra) for your Fresh Cut Chips!!  This item is a solid 4 star and recommended you eat it hot.

The Soda - Your choice of fountain or can....I snuck in a refill....not sure if it's free or not??

Kind of a small place, I watched the giants game here...quiet and enjoyable....nothing more.

So.....if your blue and you don't know where to go to
Why don't you try puttin' on the burgers.....

Gonna try the Fish and Chips next.

Will return!!
author: Alan L.

description: Well, a place that not bad to refuse, not good to recommend either. France fries are too thin to taste layers and the burger is not juicy enough.
author: Louie Z.

description:
I really want to like this place...and since trying them...I've talked myself into going elsewhere for burgers.  Overall...the place is just okay

The burger wasn't anything special...dry and boring.  However, the Fish and Chips are good and the Garlic Fries are great...they will leave you stinking for hours

I will try them again someday... but for anything other than burgers
author: Zoran L.

description: This place used to get five stars from me. I loved the Buffalo chicken salad and would order it every time I went. But a few months ago they were unable to make my salad because the dressing was unavailable. It was a special dressing crated just for that salad that worked well. After multiple occasions of them being out of that specific dressing they finally told me that they were no longer carrying that dressing. I tried the salad with other dressings but it just didn't taste good. Therefore my favorite thing on the menu is no longer available and unfortunately that has to lose a few stars. It is hard to fine a good buffalo chicken salad these days where the chicken is grilled and not breaded. Goodbye my healthy salad :( it's less likely I'll come back to this restaurant.
author: Maritza C.

description: This is one of the best places to grab some fish & chips as well as buffalo wings in the richmond district. The wings are crisp and crunchy but drenched in delicious hot sauce and they give you a side of carrots and celery with ranch dressing. The fish and chips are a big portion for what they give you where the fish is crisp and has a nice flaky crunch to it while the fries I typically will get the fresh fries which are not extremely salty and dip it instead in the hot sauce from the wings.
author: Angela S.

description: Cheeses takes aren't quite like the cheesesteaks in Philly, but this will do. It's a SF version. Fast friendly service and clean tables for eat in. They make the fries fresh! They're the best.
author: Kelly T.

description:
The buffalo wings here are intense! Super tart and spicy, just how I like it. It's also drenched in sauce, delicious!  
Their garlic fries are good, but I've had better. Still worth trying though!
The service is great and the staff is very nice. 
There's a good amount of seating as well. 
The Philly cheesesteaks here are really good, but how could you go wrong with a Philly cheesesteak right?
The food is always hot and cooked to perfection!
Would be coming back!
author: Veronica L.

description: The ultimate burger and a side of Garlic fries hits the spot! This place is cheap and pretty delicious for a hole in the wall burger place. I can't complain! It's all very good :)
author: Jacqueline J.

description:
I was in the mood for wings and decided to stop by here after work. 

The wings are small, like you'll be done with each wing in 3 bites, max.  9 wings are just the right amount for one person and costs about $6.25. 

The fries are cooked kinda funky. It's not like steakfries and there's really no crispyness. Then again, when you eat the fry, you're wondering wheres the potatoe?

There's a $10 min to use cards which I'm not a fan of.

The search continues for good wings in SF.
author: John M.

description:
[M]ona: 3.5 Stars
[W]ayne: 3.5 stars
Average: 3.5 Stars

+ Inexpensive
+ Accepts Credit Cards
+ Good variety of burgers

- Didn't like their Lemon Pepper wings
- Don't sit under the TV
- Hard to find parking

[M] Wayne and I came here in search of a new "gourmet" burger joint other than our usual Burgermeister, which can get pricey sometimes. Buffalo Burger is located in the center of the Richmond District right across the street from that Blockbuster on Geary. 

[W] When you walk in, you can get a big whiff of food being cooked on the grill. As you decide what to eat from their menu, don't forget to ask for buffalo meat if you want it. Of course there's an extra charge for that as well. Mona wanted to get that option but I totally forgot to mention it during our order, especially since it was written clearing smack dab in the middle in bold lettering haha. 

[M] The buffalo meat would have been a better option but anyway, we shared a Supreme Burger [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Nvc1XZVJZhp2CHbh_hTLUw?select=2qBog85o7hAXqw6i3o0qCg] and an order of 9 lemon-pepper wings which comes with some veggie sticks on the side. [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Nvc1XZVJZhp2CHbh_hTLUw?select=CKok9TWhauWGVRoQ5FXgzg ]Your meal includes a drink from their fridge as well so feel free to grab yourself a can of juice or whatever you like. [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Nvc1XZVJZhp2CHbh_hTLUw?select=-3bfXJubDAjn1LHmvh4hMw]

The burger is made to however you want it to be cooked. We like ours medium rare and they cook the meat here perfectly. The only part that sucked about Wayne's burger was that it didn't come with a traditional bun and the juices from the meat were soaking through. 

[W] In my opinion, when you have the perfect burger, it has to come with a perfect unsaturated bun as well. Otherwise I'm just eating a slab of meat and wet bread... bleh. 

The Lemon-pepper wings came right after the burger. Honestly, this didn't satisfy our palettes. I literally could've done a whole lot better job but I just wanted to compare this to Wingstops' lemon-pepper wings. Wingstop wins hand-down. Basically the wings were just fries and lemon juice was just squeezed all over along with pepper on top. The wings were too sour and again it's just something I could've done.

One disturbing thing about this place is that the guy that works there, probably the owner, was just chilling near the front door and watching the TV that was right above our heads from where we were sitting. I say it was disturbing because I can see at the corner of my eye that he kept staring at us. I was like WTF man! When the TV is bolted to the wall above our heads, normally your head is looking up to see the screen but she was just staring at us. That made me feel really uncomfortable but whatever, we just ate our food and tried to ignore that. 

Anyways if you come here during a weekend, good luck finding parking around this neighborhood because it seems like everyone's family including their baby and dog has a vehicle. That's the only thing that sucks when parking in the city is that there's one too many vehicles per household and they hog up all the parking. I would try this place again just to taste something else. Hopefully the guy won't be staring at us otherwise it'll just face my chair towards him and stare at him too haha. Just kidding.
author: Mona C.

description: Ate here with two friends. I got the fish burger and some fries, it was delicious! My friends got onion rings, the BBQ burger, and the Hawaiian Burger. All of us were VERY pleased with our meal and we were all in a food coma by the time we were done. For a burger joint and a quick bite, this place hits the spot.
author: Nancy C.

description:
On my solo adventure to SF yesterday, I decided to have a meal here. It was quite the gamble because I don't normally go for American food. My typical food choices would be; Korean, Vietnamese, or Thai.

After much deliberation and yelping near the Golden Gate, I decided to go for something different 'cause I had garlic fries on my mind. I also love chicken wings so I figured it was worth a shot. I ended up taking a few minutes to think about it since I never looked at the menu.. to then again stick with my original plan because it would have taken me forever otherwise...

I went with a small order (1.95) of garlic fries and a 6 pc chicken wings (4.95) with spicy teriyaki sauce. I had forgotten my wallet in my car, so they were nice enough to make the food as I went to retrieve it. I decided to sit in the back corner and one of the cooks actually brought the food to my table. 

Good amount for the price. The spicy teriyaki was actually teriyaki and buffalo sauce together. It wasn't great, but it wasn't bad either; I'm not a fan of buffalo sauce TBH. I have this thing where I eat my chicken wings with 2 forks because I don't like getting my fingers all dirty, but I had to this time because the plastic forks were weak... Picked the meat off of all of them before eating for convenience, and leaving them to be drenched in the sauce was a bad idea... because I knew my salt intake was taking a sharp spike. I think that the chicken could have been cooked a little less because it was a bit on the dry side. The garlic fries were good, but I would have liked it if there was more of the garlic goodness. Even so, can't complain for the price.

I honestly don't know if I'm going to make another stop here. That is a possibility if I decide to take someone if I'm in the area and we don't feel like the other options on Geary. If I do, I would probably go for a burger or a grilled cheese... or something.
author: Nga C.

description:
First review I've ever written because I don't usually feel strongly enough about an establishment to write one.

Good food. Of course, I had fish 'n chips so that's hard to mess up. Girlfriend approved of her supreme burger and I liked their fries--reasonably thick but still quite crispy. This alone would've been worth at least four stars to me, and it wouldn't have been easy to drop any lower. 
However, the not-so-gentleman/woman (for lack of definite identification) behind the register found a way to be the rudest, least helpful person in any food service establishment I've been to as far as my memory can take me. The interesting thing is that he/she didn't seem to be actively trying to come across as an employee that made me want to spit into their tip jar. 
Maybe you can decide for yourself:
-Girlfriend and I approached the register and she began ordering her burger. He/she didn't bother looking up or making eye contact with either of us as my girlfriend was ordering, so there was never any confirmation that he/she ever heard anything she said until he/she finally said, "Is that it?"
-I attempted to strike up some conversation with some questions about some items I was interested in ordering. I asked about the size of the fish pieces in their fish 'n chips and immediately received the answer, "Don't know." Am I the first person in the city to have ordered this? Is this your first day? Not the best impression for your first day, so I imagine you're just not interested in being helpful in the least. There are other jobs for people with your level of customer service expertise, you know. I can suggest a job in advertising. A job involving some sort of edible-animal suit and a spinning arrow with a restaurant name on it.
-I also tried to order a banana shake, and before I even finished, received another flat-toned, unenthusiastic response, "No ice cream."
-Before we got our food, he/she was cleaning a table up after some other customers didn't dispose of their trash by the door before leaving. He/she was very openly expressing his/her annoyance aloud to...no one in particular. Understandable, so sure, continue to enlighten us to how much you hate your job that you are incredibly ill-suited for.
-After this, he/she brought us our food and tossed our baskets onto our table and basically ordered us, "Make sure you throw your trash away when you're done." I responded, "Sure!" Naturally, it's obvious to throw your trash away when there's a trash can right by the door. And of course I would. But if I wanted to follow General He/She's orders, I'd join the military. But I didn't. I came to be served food.
-Last one: As we were eating, a man came in and appears to have ordered what appeared to have been a shake, evidenced by he/she pulling out a large tub and scooping something into the metal container that milkshakes are mixed in. Wow, you guys must restock fast.

In conclusion, would come back again for the food. Oh boy, just tried a bite of my girlfriend's leftovers. Definitely want to come back to try some burgers. As long as it is during this lovely gentleman/woman's shift and I get to spit into the tip jar before leaving.

Note: I don't mean to sound particularly insensitive about his/her sexual identity, and my problem is entirely about his/her attitude for the entirety of our encounter in this restaurant. My use of both male/female pronouns throughout this review is not meant to be insulting in any way, but merely to indicate that I was legitimately unsure of whether he/she would identify him/herself as a male or a female, and wished to be respectful of either scenario.
author: Kriz K.

description: Chowed down the Chili Cheese Buffalo Burger! It was extremely filling and cooked perfectly! Too messy to pick up, but I don't mind using a knife and fork. They fry their own potato chips! They are light and break apart when you bite into them! They are perfect with the burger. A perfect way to end any Sunday!
author: Jana H.

description:
5 stars - no complaints here!
Bf and I are regulars!  We come every few months and always enjoy whatever we order. Bf always orders wings super spicy and fish n chips. I've had their hamburgers, chicken sandwiches - all consistently satisfying! 

Recently had the philly cheese chicken and it was bomb! Will continue to be regulars here :)
author: A b.

description:
Boss Dude: Hey, hey, hey, long time no see...
Me: Uh, yeah.  My family and I have been trying to cut down on the red meat.
Boss Dude: So no burger.  You want onion rings?
Me: Actually, we're cutting down on the fried food, too.
Boss Dude: You want a salad?  We have salad.

Me: (Who orders a salad at a fast food place?) Uh, uh.... Um, let me think about it. How about the seafood combo?  No wait, that's fried too.  

Boss Dude: Chicken sandwich?  We have grilled chicken, if you want.
Me: (As I recall, the grilled chicken is dry).  Er no.

Customer at a table next to the counter: Man, these are the best burgers I've had in a long time.

Me: (Nervously) Uh, shoot, let me just get a burger.  A mushroom cheeseburger with bacon and uh onion rings.  Just a small order of onion rings, though. 

Boss Dude: You just want one burger?

Me: (Nodding silently)

Boss Dude: You sure?  What about your family?  You don't want any drinks?

Me (Glancing around the room, looking at all the happy munching, and obviously succumbing to the peer pressure): Six burgers, three large orders of onion rings and about six drinks.

Boss Dude: OK, your order is ready.  Here you go.

Me: OK, Thank you.  Thank you very much.

Me (Mumbling silently to myself as I head out the door): You evil, little man, you....
author: Danielle O.

description:
I hate to write a bad review here. I live close by and I've been eating here for years and have always enjoyed the food and service but in the past few months they have hired a new employee who goes by Bonny. Two times already he has been rude to my girlfriend and I. Last time we ate here he even made fun of what my girlfriend ordered. Today I tried to order buffalo shrimp fries, garlic fries, a patty melt, and lemon pepper wings and he could not even give me the price over the phone saying his pos was down. I asked him for a rough estimate of the price and he rudely responded that he wasn't going to take my order.

Buffalo burger will no longer get my service or my friends. I hope the customer service standards improve. Best of luck to the owners of the business.
author: Konar S.

description:
The burgers are simple but delicious. I always have to remember to ask for medium-rare or else my burgers are cooked well-done. Garlic fries here are wonderful. 

I think the wings and links are just okay.
author: LeTran B.

description:
Fat, fat, fatty, fat.....and I loved every mouthful of it. I shared the garlic fries (so frickin' good), mozzarella sticks (average, served with a thick ranch), a veggie burger (gardenburger) that they load up with ketchup, mustard, mayo, pickles and cheese and washed it all down with a thick chocolate shake and then waddled home dehydrated and gasping for air as my overstuffed belly left little room for oxygen. 

Happy to have this spot in the neighborhood and looking forward to them curing my next hangover.
author: Cec D.

description:
I ordered the Philly cheesesteak along with some wings. The wait time was about ten minutes which is reasonable. I got the philly first. Just looking at it I knew it was gonna be good. After the first bite I was in heaven! Great philly, gotta say one of the best I've ever had. The cheese really brought it all together.

The wings however we're boring, nothing particularly special about them. Also each wing ran you almost a buck.... Kinda pricey for generic hot wings.

Other than that everything else was ok.
author: Serge C.

description:
Delicious sauce, meaty wings, and AmaZiNg garlic fries...addictive. I come here at least twice a month for wings, maybe even once a week during baseball season. :D 

They are Asian owned so service is typical, but they are really nice and take about 20 minutes. It's always best to call ahead of time for pick ups. I would rather support local businesses than chain restaurants that don't bring support back to the city. 

I love me some wings and beer!!!!
author: Andy M.

description: 4 stars for good food. Service is only okay. We ordered a burger, Philly cheesesteak, and fish & chips. Burger was excellent - well seasoned, definitely handmade patties, served on a french roll rather than a burger bun which I prefer. Cheesesteak was good and flavorful, also on a crispy french roll. Fish and chips were deliciously crispy, served with tartar sauce but I preferred the malt vinegar that was provided on the table. French fries were definitely made in house, not the precut prepackaged frozen ones you get at other places; these were legit - golden crispy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside. All in all, food alone was enjoyable. Ambience was causal; we ate as we watched the football game on TV. Like I said, service is okay, but you're not going to a place like this for 5-star service anyway. I recommend and would come back!
author: Kortney E.

description: Deserves a much higher rating. Best Buffalo chicken wings in the city that I've had. If you want other flavors go elsewhere. They're homemade chips are also bomb.
author: Chris L.

description:
Ultimate Burger and Garlic fries. 

Burger was better than average, not mind-blowing, but pretty good. If you consider the price, the burger was great. Garlic fries were also great, definitely worth it. I'll be back.
author: Ben K.

description: This place is for sure a hole in a wall! I was with a bunch of friends randomly walking around Geary and we were hungry. We passed other food spots but they didn't seem that great. The burgers and fries are amazing. The burgers are also super meaty and big. I honestly thought it was going to be small because the prices were so cheap! If your looking some where for a big burger for a good price, come here!
author: Alexis I.

description: I've been coming here for years. The owner and employees are very nice, but today's experience was not good. The guy at the register was VERY RUDE. I've never seen him there before until today. I hope he's not there for long. It only take one bad experience to not make me wanna come back.
author: Christina S.

description:
Buffalo Burger. I heard some things about this place and wanted to try it for myself. The place looks like a run down diner on the inside... The place looks old and doesn't seem to have changed or something. Gives off a sleepy feeling. Time for a decor update? 

== Food ==

Buffalo burger. Yes, they have buffalo meat here. It's an extra $2 to get the buffalo meat. Was it worth it? I can't really tell the difference between buffalo meat and regular beef so it wasn't worth it to me. The burger overall all was alright. The patty is a big thin and the buns aren't amazing or anything. It was a pretty average burger.

Garlic fries. They're above average tasting fries, but they were really dry. Thick cuts of fries with garlic on them.

== Service ==

Service was quick and the food came out within 5 minutes, which is pretty good.

== Overall ==

An alright place. Decent burgers. It seems like the philly cheese steak is the way to go here. Maybe I'll try that when I'm nearby.
author: Steven B.

description:
Came here long long time ago, and tried the burger with buffalo meat... I don't really remember much, besides that it did not taste much different from a normal burger. So I decided to come back and try it again.

I ordered the hamburger and asked for the buffalo meat and ordered small garlic fries with it. I still think that there isn't much difference between the buffalo meat and beef. I actually think that the buffalo meat is a bit more bland and dry. But it was still pretty good.

The fries were really good though. I love how they put a lot of garlic into it and the fries were cooked perfectly. Crispy on the outside but soft on the inside. Sooooo yummy.
author: Alicia W.

description: came here Christmas Eve because i was already in the area. My bf always talks about this place because he used to come here often as a high schooler so he wanted me to try it. It's pretty similar to Beep's Burgers. I had the fish and chips with garlic fries and he had the bacon mushroom cheeseburger. Fish  was smaller than i expected. So was the burger. A little pricey for the portion and it tasted alright. But i can understand the pricing - competition is tough in Richmond. Service was pretty good tho. If i'm craving burgers in the area, i'll def be back
author: Kristina L.

description:
My gf and I were on the bus heading towards the Golden Gate Bridge. We were right in Richmond and we suddenly got hungry and decided to find a spot to eat at before spending a few hours at the bridge. 

It took us a few minutes to decide what we wanted to order. As we were looking at the small print on the menu, we noticed many customers coming in. It seems that this place stays busy consistently. 

I ordered a philly cheese steak sandwich, a chicken bacon sandwich and garlic fries. I was pleased with my sandwich but it was quit small. The bread was soft and crispy, the meat was tender and the cheese was good. For $6, I think it was too small. The garlic fries were a bit stale and had too much garlic on them. 

I was upset at how small the tables were. I felt like an adult sitting on a preschool table. I kept knocking over the napkin holder, ketchup bottle and getting stuck with the table and chair. As far as the interior, its too simple and white. It made the place feel empty and cold. In matter of fact, it was cold inside. 

The service was fast but the customer service wasn't' the greatest.
author: Alexis D.

description: Great service and delicious food. Ordered the spicy BBQ chicken wings, philly cheese steak, and the chicken club sandwich. Everything was great and well priced. I will definitely be back.
author: Julia S.

description:
Drunk finger foods.

If I hadn't decided to go vegetarian I would have ordered the buffalo wings at least once a week. Onion rings,burgers, cheese sticks and sweet potato fries are served in large portions and it is notably affordable. Beware, you may get fat.
author: Hannah A.

description:
I love this place. 

I admittedly get the same thing everytime, but that's just because it's too good to stray away from. I've never tried anything that I did not like, but I'm all about the buffalo chicken breast sandwich. It's got the works in between good bread; cheese, onions, avocado, bacon...yum! Also, give their chips a try. 

You know what, aside from it taking a while at times, you really can't go wrong with this place.
author: Barrett I.

description:
When walking into this ordinary & slightly depressing hole in the wall I wasn't expecting anything out of this world, just something fairly decent. I mean, it always seems busy, so they must be doing something right, right? 

I was having one of my occasional little guilty-pleasure-cravings for spicy Buffalo wings, so what better place than Buffalo Burger??  Wait. I'm somehow thinking now I should have gone when I was craving a burger...

Anyway, I got the spicy "buffalo wings" . I liked the traditional tangy sauce, but the wings were gristly, and downright yucky. They were made up of protruding bones and cartilage, with very little stringy meat. I got  my two elementary aged kids the fish and chips to share. I couldn't believe the amount of grease dripping off the fish when you picked it up- just GROSS. My kids will eat anything fried, but even they took only one bite of the soggy fish and put it down. They ate the fries, but kids will eat anything resembling a french fry. What I tasted were obviously from a cheap and frozen source (and also terribly, terribly greasy). 

Just every bite didn't taste fresh and was of the lowest quality that money can buy.
Perhaps the burgers are good--too bad I would never be daring enough to go back in there to try one.
author: nancy s.

description:
I'm surprised that I don't already have a review for this place. I come here pretty often, especially when I'm in need of a quick greasy food fix or I'm on the way to the bank.

Everything is relatively cheap and tasty (at least everything I've tried). I usually get the 6 piece wings in spicy bbq and yes all they do is toss it in their spicy buffalo sauce then drizzle it with bbq, but it's sure tasty. It also comes with carrot/celery sticks and your choice of ranch or bleu cheese. Most items will run you about $4-5. Let me tell you, GET THE GARLIC FRIES! They're so good. Once in a while they don't come out as crispy, but most of the time they're crispy garlicy goodness. I think they fry it in garlic oil or something, because the flavor is definitely there. Lately, I've been getting the BLTA sandwich on white, which is very simple and basic. I have also tried the burger and fish and chips and they were all pretty good. Nothing has let me down at buffalo burger thus far.

The owner is always here and is usually the one who will take your order and bring your food to the table. I love buffalo burger. It's fast, cheap, and good. The only thing that peeves me a bit is that they actually charge you .50cents for dipping sauces like bbq, ranch, honey mustard etc. Otherwise, if you're in the area and looking for good old fried finger foods, this is your place.
author: Stine H.

description: Just had an awesome buffalo chicken sandwich. Very friendly staff. Really good little hole in the wall
author: Chris M.

description: Five star for the fries! Real fresh potatoes. The wings are good. The burgers are big and juicy. This is not fine dining but it is solid comfort greasy spoon grub!
author: Rebecca M.

description:
Great cheesesteaks.. Not so oily and tons of flavor. I usually put hot sauce on everything. And I mean EVERYTHING. To the point where some question if my butt will be on fire later on. But tonight, I said no to the sauce. I enjoyed the savory sandwich in it's pure form. 

Side of garlic fries to boot. Warning...took 2 brushings for the bf to fully get the garlic taste out. But I think garlic is sexy. With hot sauce.
author: Maria B.

description:
I ate here last night with my 7 year old son. It was good--what you would expect of a burger joint. They have the fries, onion rings, wide selection of burgers... they even had a light option for me as I am trying to watch my weight. 

Son ordered a cheeseburger and onion rings. It was tasty, but didn't really stand out. The onion rings were yummy, too. Fried to perfection. But alas, fried anything is greasy. But as fried foods go, these were great.

I had a grilled chicken breast sandwich. I was actually surprised at how tender and flavorful it was despite it being pressed thin. It had me wondering if it just so happened to have some of that cheeseburger juice on it (which may have made it so yummy). As a dieter, I only ate 1/2 the bun (they are HUGE), but anyway, I still walked away quite satisfied. 

The food did take a bit to prepare though. They call it fast food, but it was a little longer than that. Maybe because it's made to order?
author: Lisa C.

description: Their French fries are always really good. The chicken salad is yum (I was drunk though).. I'll go again!
author: Ashley F.

description: My favorite restaurant near my place. The burgers and garlic fries are great. My friends really liked chicken wings too
author: Nitish S.

description:
This place is pretty good for some wings and burgers, but unfortunately there is this suposite girl that works there that has the worst attitude I have ever seen in the service industry. I actually apologized when he/she got my order worng and he/she said "it's too late" WTF. Who says that. I hope to talk to the owner some day so he can fix the problem before no one goes to his restaurant anymore. She's really that bad. 
Normally I don't give 1 star because of one person, but I would give him/her negative stars if I could. I don't wish his/her presence on my worst enemy. Good luck to any brave soul that still goes to buffalo burger after reading this.
author: mikayla m.

description:
Great burgers.  This place has been in SF for as long as I can remember (I grew up there).

It's sort of a dive and situated in a nonchalant part of the block, but dont let their looks fool you!

I've only tried buffalo burgers from this place, but I love love love it, and the sauce is tangy and has a great kick to it!  Very affordable and the home made chips are a must!
author: Michelle W.

description:
Been on the hunt for a burger made from buffalo meat - not hand ground, niman ranch blah blah blah beef. 

Buffalo Burger serves burgers made from buffalo meat. Granted they appear most likely of the frozen variety. I requested medium rare - which was denied & so I had to settle for medium. It arrived well done - disappointing. On the upside it wasn't tough nor dry. Iceberg lettuce & thin tomato slices (wish they were thicker or more of them).

The side of homemade potato chips was fantastic - thick cut & crisp. I can easily forgo potato chips & can eat just 1 from the mass produced bags - but hey, I'm human & can't resist homemade fried goodness. 

Damage:  less than 10 bucks.

No ambiance & it was freezing inside.
author: Kim S.

description: Our son picked this place after a Yelp search and we're glad he did. We received a friendly greeting from Bonnie (sorry if I misspelled that) and she was helpful with the menu suggestions. We had the fish and (excellent) chips, the Philly Cheesesteak, BBQ bacon cheeseburger, jalapeño poppers and a shake and everything ROCKED!! Great food, super- friendly service. Seriously, Bonnie was so nice and cool, and again, a great deal for wonderful food. GO TO THIS PLACE!!! You'll be glad you did. We'll be back.
author: Elma K.

description:
First time here and first time eating eating fish and chips! Ordered the garden Burger... no...not again. Definitely go with the burgers (cuz that's what they're known for!) I also tried fish n' chips for the first time in my life! (Yes....believe it..) They make the gigantic chips themselves and the fish was moist, so I threw it into my boring garden burger and yum!

It's a nice hang out spot and during the right time in the afternoon, the street of geary looks almost dream-like. Makes me happy I live in SFC ^^
author: Anna H.

description:
Buffalo is one of my favorite places to grab a quick, cheap dinner when I'm out in the Avenues. I've had the fish & chips, chicken sandwiches, and hamburgers, all good.   The french fries are fresh, delicious.  

Limited indoor seating, but (and this may be a secret...) they'll deliver to McKenzie's and to Nag's Head, happily.

Buffalo beats out Bill's down the street bc they toast the buns.
author: Meg W.

description: My hunt is not yet over, but as far as I can tell these are the best Buffalo Wings in San Francisco (okay - maybe Kezar is better - but it's close). Perfectly crispy, lots of meat on 'dem bones, great sauces. Yes please. To be fair, I've never eaten anything here that *isn't* the Wings or the Fish & Chips (which are also very good). If you need junkiness and saturated fats - which everyone does - this is a great little spot.
author: Jeremy T.

description: Wow, the only place that I can get a real buffalo burger. Very over the top restaurant. It is the best, can not beat it.
author: Krystal S.

description:
Tasty grease pit to warm up your rain soaked toes.

After pulling a two-movie marathon (warm regards to my Netflix queue) with the fellow that I'm seeing, I was slightly hungry and the idea of getting out in the open air prove stimulating to my senses.  We had just finished back-to-back serious heavy cop dramas and I knew that my usual chatter would be cut short reflecting back on the corruption, death and autonomy of the NYPD  ;o) 

My date led us here, right on the main drag and it was totally empty.  I've always heard of this place but never really ventured by so it was a nice welcome.  I'm always up for trying new places.

Buffalo Burger is probably known more for their wings, french fries and cheese steaks (for another $1.00 you can request a Buffalo burger patty) and I will order as such moving forward.  However, I was craving my usual slap of hamburger so I ordered the standard burger, medium rare.  We also ordered a basket of fries to share between us.

I chose the counter facing the street.  I never use to like this setting, but when I was in NY, I was seduced and forever changed.  There is something very voyeuristic about sitting facing a busy road and watching the people walk by.  Some sad.  Some busy on their cellphones.
