A world rolling by and all that separates you is a sheet of glass.

Our burgers took about 5-10 minutes.  Nothing a small verbal exchange can't handle.  They were huge.  The bun was typical of the mass produced kind, complete with the smattering of sesame seeds.  But it was topped the way I like it:  two large slices of tomato, a ring of spicy red onions, two pickles and a leaf of iceberg lettuce.  I asked for a side of mayo, because that's just the kind of gal I am.  Not to mention, I like to dip my french fries in that creamy goodness.  The hamburger, slightly more medium to well done, was actually very tasty once I spruced it up with the mayo.  Our french fries were rough cut, with the skin still apparent.  Thick sticks of starchy hot delights.  As I took bites here and there, I noticed that once we were eating more people were actually taking the time to look in.  Perhaps the tables had been turned?

To cut any sort of silence between bites there is a flat screen on the wall.  At a point in time where my eyes darted to the screen, one player had two of a kind, Jacks.  By the time the flop was laid out, another Jack lay on the table.  Nice.  Three of a kind.  He won that hand, all in.

I also ordered a soft drink which includes free refills for dine in customers.  Our tab was around $13 with tax.  Not bad for the two of us and enough to somewhat dull the muddled senses from the cop movie marathon.  Casual and quick, good for the late night munchies run.  Next time the buffalo wings will be my order.  I'm not comfortable to gnaw on a bone in front of my date yet  ;o)
author: Miika M.

description: Freshly made burgers on the spot. I got the Hawaiian burger and it tasted awesome. It had enough sauce for the flavor that the moment I took a bite, the sauces started leaking out. At first I though the grilled pineapples wouldn't go well, but I was wrong. The beef and everything in it just came together. Though, I felt like one of the staffs in the back was being passively rude during our meal. Would have been a 4/5. Way to kill the mood. Nonetheless, it's a solid burger spot on Geary.
author: Tony C.

description: If you are looking for chicken wings in the inner richmond, then Buffalo Burger is your place to go. Everybody there is really  nice, and knows what they're doing. We have chicken wings almost every week, and when we do, its Buffalo Burger all the way. It is our reward for working hard all week. Thanks!
author: Sam F.

description:
Been here twice now... Both times the place stunk like acrid badger shit. You know badger shit must stink because you can see all the craziness they eat on youtube and shit!

First time I went there I had the wings. My review? ...Gross. GROSS. They are soggy and quite honestly I think they're the culprit to why that stench is in there.

Second time I went I had the philly cheesesteak without mushrooms and garlic fries. That shit was good... I could eat that again if I could get past the smell inside..

You have to remember the place you're eating at though, ... It's a fast food joint. However not even Jack In The (shit) Box smells like that!
author: Seth H.

description:
My roommate has always shamelessly plugged in Buffalo Burger in every non related conversation.  For example:
Me: How was your day bra?
Him: Busy...I went to school to print out some pictures then scouted some places for shoots...o btw...Buffalo Burger is so good

This abrupt shift in tangents leave me floored and flummoxed at the same time.  Buffalo Burger has also been a Richmond staple since I was a kid, however, I never had the urge to go...until yesterday at the request of lil Twist.  Walking in, this place seems to be the headquarters for many a characters.  There was a group of high schoolers taking up a couple tables playing cards, some couples in a booth enjoying NCAA and this boss elderly man craning his neck and speaking his order literally .5 inches away from the cashier's face then going outside to smoke a huge cigar.   Lil Twist and I ordered the philly cheesesteaks to go and when we got home, had trouble removing said sandwiches from the paper trey.  Philly cheesesteaks are messy by nature, but this was over the top messy.  Once I was able to remove half and take a bit, all the ingredients tumbled out.  There was a generous splay of beef, cheese, mushrooms, onions and bell peppers however, it just tasted bad.  The beef was sweet like it was marinated in teriyaki sauce.  In addition, the consistency of the beef was like mush.  It was soft to a point of 0_0 (wtf face).  We resorted to eat our sandwich with a spoon.  The cheesesteak tasted nothing like one should and was probably the worst I've eaten.  The sweet beef was just not cool.  Basically, if you come here ordering a philly cheeseteak, be prepared to get philly cheese soup.  

On another note, I don't want to bash this place completely.  Because this place is named Buffalo Burger, perhaps it should have been wise to order a burger, their named specialty.  It could be that I just ordered an item they are not known for, which is not an excuse on their part.  I will try this place one more time before I desist from biting my tongue.  Btw, they serve homemade potato chips which I do want to try.  This is the first place where Fish 'n Chips truly mean just that.
author: Brian V.

description:
Prob one of the best burger joint.   
Tasty buffalo wings with dipping

Their garlic fries could do better but everything else is DELICIOUS ! 

It's a small plaace but good for going with couple friends or grabbing to-go

they have TV so they always show NBA games and what not
author: Paul J.

description:
First time I got food from here I was considering the philly cheese steak. My friend lived right by it (I live near it too now) and said he didnt like the cheesesteak there cuz it was hella messy. (actually i dont think he used the word "hella", thats just my brain translating, he's from Massachusetts)

I got take out and much to my surprise it was one of the neatess least messiest cheesesteaks id ever seen. So i didnt understand what he was talking about

Until the other day I had another one there. The guy served me the cheesesteak with a fork, that gave a hint. The sandwich for some reason this time fell apart nearly immediately. They use colombo rolls which are tasty (but small), wonder if they used a different one before.

Now to the actual taste...beside it falling apart super easily..the steak seems to have been marinated in some sort of sauce, similar to terriyaki or another japanese sweetish salty sauce. At first this sauce is tasty but as I predicted it gets old real quick. Besides real cheesesteak's steak should not be marinated or sauced, only lightly seasoned with salt pepper etc.

So the cheese steak is edible, but def not traditional and def not that great. 

I will not have another cheesesteak here again, though I'm interested to try their buffalo wings, they have many flavors. 

The man who runs the front of the restaurant is very good with cleaning up and making sure the restaurant is in order, which is nice when you are serving such greasy ass foodz. He also seems polite, not the chinese assho type that is common in the Richmond eateries.
author: Belito L.

description:
Nothing fancy, but clean, nice, and reasonably priced.  Convenient, if you're in the area and a good place for a quick bite.  Had a very late lunch there recently and loved the pricing of the burgers, but ended up ordering their fish and chips which cost more,but was more of what I was craving at the time.   The three pieces of fish were smaller than I expected, but also tasted a lot better than I expected as well.  Nicely cooked and they were actually pretty good...a screaming bargain after the $23.99 for fish and chips at Fish in Sausalito the other day.

Homemade potato chips were a nice change of pace from the usual fries.  With a can of Diet Coke, the total came out to $9.80.  Not too many places like this in the area and it's open late too.  If you take it for what it is, it's not bad at all.  Works for me.
author: Roy N.

description:
I have ordered wings and tried all the flavors and they were good.
I like that it comes with carrots and celery.
One star off because they have hydrogenated oil in the frying oil (Maybe in the bleu cheese and ranch sauces too but I'm just guessing) because it is not good for you.
All in all I will be back to try the sandwiches.
author: Vincent T.

description:
The bacon avocado burger was delicious, and beautifully layered.

The garlic fries were real GARLIC fries, and reminded me of the garlic butter toast my mom used to make me.

And it was cheap: burgers are around 5 bucks, plus some change if you want special toppings.
author: Surat L.

description:
If you Google'd "hole in the wall", I'm sure this place would appear.

Basically, this place is a total dive.  Everything is overpriced for a burger joint and not to mention you have to pay for everything separately.  When you order a burger it doesn't come with fries or a drink.  The place is small and cramped.  

You're better off hitting up a fast food chain, at least you know you're getting your moneys worth.
author: Valentino L.

description: This rating is totally for their meau and foods but the male cashier "the younger one" had the worst attitude ever, I had been working in customer service field for 10 years, I never seen anything  worse  than that !!
author: Ricky K.

description:
I feel very unhealthy after I ate here, hence the 3 stars. But overall, it was very tasty!

I got the Hawaiian Chicken Burger (grilled chicken with pineapples) and it was quite delicious. But it became a huge mess at the end with all the juices dripping everywhere, so it became a knife and fork type of dish haha. 

We also got the Buffalo Shrimp with fries, and that was okay. They were small little fried shrimps, with buffalo and tomato sauce on the side. I personally like the tomato sauce a lot more than the buffalo sauce. 

The wings are supposedly amazing here, but perhaps next time...

p.s. It's mostly hard to find parking around here, but they have a garage right where Ross is and the rates are really cheap.
author: Diana L.

description: The food is just okay. Nothing special about the burgers. Its not good but it also isn't nasty. I ordered a bacon and mushroom burger and garlic fries to go. The burger looks huge but once you unwrap it, it is actually all bread. The patty was thin and they forgot my bacon! I was pretty upset that i didn't get bacon. There were also very little mushroom. So the burger tasted pretty plain. The garlic fries were not even garlicky at all! There was only a hint of garlic. Whack. Garlic fries NEEDS to be very garlicky like the ones at the baseball stadium. Yum. The lady taking my order was nice though. Overall food quality was disappointing.
author: Debbie Y.

description:
I LOVE buffalo wings!

My friend and I often eat at a dessert place up the street and one day we parked near here and we couldn't resist coming by since we both love to eat buffalo wings! The ones here are drenched in the buffalo sauce (YES!) and you can order it as spicy as you'd like. For a first try, we chose a safe level of spiciness. But next time we come, I am going to ask for it much spicier! 

Aside from the deeeelicious buffalo wings, we ordered a small side of chips, which are fresh potatoes thinly sliced and deep fried. They are so much better than potato chips and definitely rival french fries! SO DELICIOUS!

I have heard the burgers are good and I see people here watching sports, but we girly girls come by to get down and dirty with the wings!
author: Stella C.

description: it's been like 3 or 4 years since i last came here, but this restaurant hasn't changed much. this place is still one of the best burger joints in town hands down. most of these burger places in the city charges 9-10$ for a decent sized burger, if not less than normal size. this place charges 5-8$ and has a large variety of burgers, fries, fish and chips, sandwiches, even rice bowls. the burgers, fries, and although i haven't tried there fish and chips and sandwiches, i'm sure is also delicious. also very large portions, so it's definitely worth your money. you can't go wrong coming here. you can't
author: Jason A.

description:
My boyfriend and I love Buffalo Burgers.  When we saw this place driving down Geary we we excited to try it.... also presenting a non-asian food choice as we live in the neighborhood.   I ordered the avocado burger (hold onions and mayo).  He ordered the ultimate burger with the works and we had both buffalo style ($2 extra each).

What We Got:  2 Dry burgers- Avocado burger with the works and the ultimate burger hold the onions and mayo. (GRR!)  I'm sure it was buffalo but I could not tell at all.  It was definitely frozen meat and pretty tasteless.  We also ordered a side of onion rings which was not bad but unimpressive.  Total was $21 we regret spending.  We both walked out still hungry :(

For the record though the fish and chips looked good, but I didn't try it.  I mean, the place is called Buffalo burgers!
author: Suz L.

description:
Size matters.
Yes, it does
People like it if it's big.
A Dripping Hot Mouthful Big Thing.
That's the truth and it's sexy.
It's a HUGE SINGLE BURGER for $4.50
BIGGEST 4,50 BURGER IN SF !!!!
This is good deal burger here.
The burger was pretty juicy, the sesame bun was good, so as the fries.

I SHALL RETURN.
author: Nobu K.

description: Great burgers and great service.  Their buffalo burger patty is exceptional and the views are nice as well.  Had to dock a couple of stars solely due to pricing.  I got the buffalo burger with just a small handful of fixings, and one beer, and my total with tip and tax came to 42.
author: Jesse J.

description:
If you're near that area, please walk slowly 'cause you might miss this restaurent. It doesn't stand out and it's ran by a chinese family, but they KNOW their american burgers. The place was packed when i went, so i sat by the window, after 10 mins, the order was ready, and the fries and the burger was so big i knew i wasn't able to finish it. The fries were freshly made, and the Ultimate Burger i got had ample avocado in it (just the way i like it), the grilled onions and bacon are individually seasoned too (i think) which makes the burger an explosion of favors. If you're not so into strong favors, try patty melt. The bread is the regular rye bread slices, and it's grilled onions, ketchup and cheese, it might sound simple, but the texture was great! 

I really wish i had the stomach space to try the wings D:, maybe next time
author: Lizi F.

description:
Great, cheap spot to satisfy your burger cravings without spending $10+ for good burgers..

They recently remodeled the place and it looks better then before.. The owner was really nice and was joking around with us.. The menu was BIG. Not only do they have burgers, they also serve buffalo wings, fish and chips, Philly cheese steaks, chicken sandwiches, buffalo shrimps, mozzarella cheese sticks, and salads.

My burger was huge even though it's only 6oz of beef.. I didn't like how the burger was smaller then the bun though.. I had plenty of bun left after the burger.. But the burger was pretty darn good and juicy... Served with your usual burger toppings.. I had bacon on mine but it was all clumped into one another so I had to touch the greasy bacon to pull them apart... I also ordered a small side of potato chips.. Gotta order this. A small is like a large and a large is like a XXL...! The chips were not greasy at all and I think it's better then the fries..

They also have some bomb ass chili cheese fries.. Yummy...
author: Juliane N.

description:
A solid burger joint in this part of town.
The burgers are tasty, and the fries are thickly cut (and NOT greasy!  YAY!)
It's too bad you have to order everything separately, but hey - the fast food chains do it that way.
My brother and I were REALLY hungry when we visited, so everything tasted extra fabulous to us.
My recommendation:  Try the Avocado burger, but add mushrooms and Swiss cheese.  Soooo good.  ^_^
author: Christine G.

description:
I had the Philly Cheese Steak, and it was so delicious. I'm not quite sure of what sauce they put inside, but I am sure that it really makes the sandwich tastier. 

The food and selection here is definitely better than Belly's, and it's cheaper, too!
author: pauline joy r.

description:
I come here for the burgers, mostly. But wings and Philly Steaks are also good. Wings are a little tough for me, but that's the cooking style.

Back to the burgers. Most cost around $5 and change. A great value in the city. You can pay a lot more for a burger plenty of other places. Needless to say, there's million places to get a burger. But there's do stand out. Juicy, always freshly grilled. Good balance of toppings, depending on what you order. They'll make it however you want. Makes it my local go-to for burgers, other places I'll order something else. 

You can also substitute a buffalo patty for an additional charge. If you've never had buffalo, it's leaner than beef with a meatier flavor without being to gamey. 

Another reason I love this place is the home made fries and chips. I have a little rule, I only order fries at a place unless they are homemade or at least a really well seasoned. Can't stand limp, soggy generic grease sticks from a bag in the freezer. Not worth the calories and fat to me. Some reviewers seem to prefer those, to each their own, I guess, Micky D's sure sells a lot of them. Not for me.
author: Michael R.

description:
I absolutely love this place.  Their burgers--juicy, fresh and just delicious.  I love their fish-and-chips--real homemade chips or fries, your choice.  Their fried seafood is just so good.  I love their hot wings and other appetizers too!  

The service is good, as it is run by the owners only, and they're friendly and quick.  

Seating is limited, but take out is good, so long as you're not driving too far.  

Cash only policy.  It's worth going to the ATM for it!  Trust me...I've done it way too many times.  :-)

Note: This review is based on when I frequented in 2004-2007, but not since the 'remodel' that everyone else is talking about.  Guess, I will have to go and see what the fuss is about.

EDIT 1/15/08:
Same good food!  They take credit cards now!  And they have actual seating now!   

For you whiners, stuff it.  Let the rest of us enjoy our food.  

Go, you go now! :-D
author: Fannie S.

description: Today was my first experience with Buffalo Burger. Ordered by phone, told it would be ready in ten minutes. It was! And it was still hot when I got it home. Double, bacon cheeseburger and garlic fries. The burger was perfect. huge and the fries were even better. Fair price. Friendly and efficient staff. I'll be back ... after several hours on the treadmill.
author: NEIL L.

description: My last review for Buffalo got flagged because I only wrote "Ew." - I guess Yelp didn't think it was "personal" enough. So here's my very personal experience at Buffalo: it gave me the diarrhea and the chicken was dry. Granted it was $5, but you REALLY get what you paid for, aka it's not worth it.
author: Christine A.

description:
Great spot if you're in the neighborhood. 

They've got some of the most reasonably priced burgers in SF, and they're tasty too!

-1/2 star for having a $10 credit card minimum.
author: Murphy O.

description:
I was born and raised in Buffalo, NY.  Chicken wings (or as San Franciscans call them, Buffalo Wings) were also born and raised in Buffalo, NY.  I have high standards for chicken wings.  Buffalo Burger has OK wings.  They were a bit small, and not as crispy as they should be, but the hot sauce was good and the chicken was tasty. Not bad for the West Coast.

I also ordered a Philly Cheese Steak, which was mediocre.  I know what you're thinking: "What kind of asshole orders a Philly Cheese Steak in San Francisco from a place called Buffalo Burger Restaurant?"  My answer: This asshole.
author: Nick F.

description: My two cents.  Foods great, service is lacking but not rude, just disinterested.  I eat here often as I live near by and I go for the food and take it home.  Great wings with a variety of flavorings.  Love the fries and onion rings were bomb.  Burgers and cheese steaks are on point.  If you want service with a smile go somewhere else.  If you want bomb ass food go here often.
author: Kevin N.

description: Meh. Meh. Meh. The burgers here are pretty boring. I was pleased by the amount of avocado I could get for a modest up-charge, but the buns they use are just terrible. The meat was cooked to post-apocalyptic, and there is almost no reason (and certainly none related to flavor) to pay $2 for the "buffalo." (Is it actually bison?! I'm not sure.) What's making the joint 3 stars instead of two is how cheap it is. If you opt for beef (which you probably should do), you can get a cheeseburger for less than $5. Just set your expectations to "under $5."
author: Luke M.

description:
i didn't feel like a burger, so i ordered the fish and chips.
not terrible but nothing special either.
recent remodel on the dining space so it's cleaner than your average burger joint.
got to go for the wings next time.
watch for an update soon.
author: Jeff W.

description:
their burgers are good. I really like them and when I feel like I want my day's worth of calories and I don't care how im going to get it, i come here. the ultimate burger is awesome, and if you have to get anything on the menu, be sure to get their garlic fries! they are the bomb, just don't let them get soggy.

the only thing about this place that I have to say is that sometimes I don't know if we get real buffalo meat. One time we ordered for it and noticed the meat looked more like beef. the patty's are pretty thin too. I would also call in to pick up if you aren't planning to eat there, because if you order there, you might have to wait a while for your meal. We waited for about 25 minutes. good place though, definitely try it out.
author: Katie O.

description: Good food, good price. You really can't mess up a burger, but you have to try their homemade fries and chips! There's nothing special about this place except for that, but if you ever crave a good burger and fries and don't have much money, Buffalo Burger is a good place to go.
author: Sara K.

description:
5 stars for the best fresh chips!
-1 star because their fish should be called batter.

I came here with my bf today because I was craving fish and chips and he had a brilliant idea in taking me here to fulfill that urge. I ordered 2 pieces of fish with their lovely fresh chips. It looked delicious until I saw my pieces of glistening, greasy battered filets of fish. Sigh. The kitchen didn't need to hurry that much! I was glad that I got what I wanted but not what I was expecting.

One thing and only one keeps me coming back here and it's the chips. I buy a large bag and I'm good to go. I haven't tried much else but I'm content with that for the time being while I finish NOM'n on the golden crisp goodies in my brown bag. :)
author: Carol L.

description:
In short, totally friendly on the wallet, food was delicious, and an abundance of drinks (diet Pepsi and diet Coke? Heyyyyyy).

Kinda of place that has you thinking, What makes this so good? Eff it, I don't care, it's that good. Also, don't let its semi-hole-in-the-wall appearance fool you, it's anything but. You could get a far less amazing, more expensive burger at a bigger, fancier venue. Trust me, I know, its happened to the best of us.

One of my favorite things was my burger actually came with food on it, none of this "would you like to add lettuce or tomato?" Each vehicle comes STANDARD with plenty of lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, and sauce. 

Try the Avocado burger like I did to ensure meal happiness.
author: Kendra S.

description:
Used to come here all the time when I worked in the area. They knew who I was when I called in because I always ask them to cut my burger in half. 

I only get the spicy bacon cheeseburger with everything on it burger. Love! The spicy sauce they use is the same stuff they use on their wings. I love that they fry their wings so there's a crunch and then they smother it in sauce. Extra spicy is perfect and will make me break a sweat while numbing my lips. Yum! I love the chips there too! Fresh and  crispy. Only big boo is that they charge for ranch... 

The owner is super friendly and I don't recall I time where knave been there and he hasn't. Whenever I crave a burger and don't want to go far, I come here.
author: Jeannie L.

description:
I love Buffalo Burger. For three years I've been going through phases of my favorite things there. First it was the burgers. Then it was the Buffalo Chicken sandwich, now it's the wings. Everything I've had there is just perfect. There's nothing I would change about it. Awesome bread, delicious meat, very saucy and never dry.

They have buffalo meat too. And buffalo wing sauce. They even have lemon pepper wings, which is pretty rare here. 

But the potato chips. Holy potato chips. They're the real winners. Homemade potato chips, mandolin-ed and deep fried idaho gold.
author: Alex M.

description:
I go to this place often because it's just down the street from the apt. I've eaten in and picked up take-out. The food is ready fast. 

So, the place has burgers, wings, fish&chips. All the food groups. The burgers are ok. Nothing really fantastic about them. I LOVE a good hamburger and I hardly ever order that here. 

What do I always order here that is absolutely top-notch? The garlic fries! They are super-duper tasty. So garlicky and awesome. Just fantastic! I can't get enough of them. They also have homemade potato chip thingies. They're very good as well. I also order the fish & chips a lot. Surprisingly, the fried fish is decent. It's perfectly crispy on the outside and the fish is delicious. 

Warning: The cheesesteak sandwiches are NOT the traditional cheesesteak you're probably thinking of. I think they use teriyaki marinated meat for the cheesesteak, so if you're into that sort of thing, give this place a shot. Especially if you love garlic!
author: Malisha J.

description: Man this place is packed tonight! Their Philly Cheese Steak is boom!!! Don't forget their fresh cut chips cause it's off da hook!!! The people there work so hard and are super friendly.
author: Michele T.

description:
I came to this place because my friend recommended it. She loves their homemade chips.

Food:

Buffalo Potato Chips: Crispy not soggy, fresh, not too greasy.
Buffalo Wings: It had a lot of flavor, a tad bit hot for me.

If you are want to get some wings and chips, this is the place to stop.

Enjoy!
author: Irene L.

description:
Man I was hoping for a nice tasty burger but I was let down by a variety of factors here at Buffalo Burger.

At first I thought it was a place that specialized in buffalo meat burgers, which they may, but the logo on the signage was that of the buffalo wings style places (which I do love actually!). 

Anyhow, I decided to test out a standard burger as I always do at a new place so there's not too much to confuse the palette.  So the good thing was that they had onion rings, but it was $2.95 for a side of them which you can see in the pic I uploaded.  Then the ranch was another $0.50 as well -  that was a bit high it seemed, but I know how you have to maximize things as a small biz.

The burger itself was decent, but a bit oily and I guess when it's a thinner patty it's hard to get one that's actually medium rare as it was cooked much more thoroughly than MR.

I think post-hangover this place would be better than just a straight up lunch/meal..
author: Gene X.

description:
This place is overrated. I've been here twice. 
Everything here is really greasy, ESPECIALLY the chips. The buffalo meat was dry. The chips and french fries and fried fish were all under seasoned. The first time I went here, the fish batter on the fish was too soft but the fish in it was cooked perfectly. The second time, the batter was good but the fish was a little overcooked/dry.The buffalo wings taste a bit odd and the ranch sauce for the celery had dry lumps on the bottom like it was old.
author: Jason C.

description:
Attention potato chip fans:  *THEIR CHIPS- you HAVE to order their chips!*  SO, so much better than just french fries!  I got greedy and ordered the large size for $2.75- it really was enough for 4 of us to share!  

I also ordered their Cheese Steak- it came out a bit different than what I was expecting but DANG- it was good!  It tasted more like a Teriyaki sandwich, dripping with yummy sauce.  A steal for only $4.95- I will definitely be back...real soon!
author: Judy K.

description:
Chicken wings are hands down the best. I usually get the 6 piece mild wings (some times they throw in an extra wing) which comes with celery and carrot sticks + bleu cheese dip. Pretty cheap for about $5.

I've tried their garlic fries which were really good. 

Credit/Debit if over $10.

Highly recommend this place!
author: Jen M.

description: On a whim, I stopped in and ordered the Philly Cheesesteak with no peppers or mushrooms. Mushrooms should be right out anyway, not authentic. The cheese was Monterey Jack - not reasonable as a default cheese on a Philly Cheesesteak. The meat was freaking Teriyaki-flavored. This sandwich was absolutely nothing remotely like it should have been. But if sold as a Teriyaki Beef sub, it'd be worth one more star.
author: Joe G.

description:
I was pleasantly surprise that their fish and chips here was pretty good!!!  I knew it was frozen but it's probably one of the best frozen fish and chips that I have ever had.  I asked them, in a very polite manner of course, if these fish filets were frozen.  He said Yes they are!!!  Then he goes on to explain the reasoning behind frozen fish filets.

The reason why they choice frozen over fresh is because it is less oily.  I go really?!?  He goes absolutely.  He goes on to tell me that there is far less oil on the frozen one than the fresh ones.  I had to agree with him while I was eating.  The fish was surprisingly moist and the batter was crispy. I am still a little puzzled by the moistness from a frozen fish.  The tartar sauce was good and the fries that came with it was good.

So........if you are ever around the richmond district in San Francisco and craving for amazingly moist fish and chips that are frozen.  Look no further!!!!
author: jason g.

description: This place is great for a quick bite to eat. It's not to pricey and has a sizable menu.
author: Kristen M.

description:
I'm not reviewing this based on the service, because there isn't much service involved. There is only this one guy who takes your order and maybe 1-2 guys in the back (but visible) making your food. 

When your order is ready, that one guy who took your order, brings the food out to you.  
He doesn't enjoy his job and he is bored out of his mind so you will not see him smiling.  
He needs you to make a decision and not be indecisive. 
He needs you to make the order clearly and quickly and he will not be patiently waiting because he is annoyed with you.  
Do not change your order after he started writing it down on his notepad or he will be very upset.  
Do not ask others in your party what they prefer and be wish-washy about anything, or else he will not be happy with you.  
You must not pause while making your order.  
Do not think too much and just order already!!!  

 oh dear! the pressure of standing there and ordering food from him was stressful!! I was sweatin' beads!  *phew*  now that you've ordered...go sit down and wait for your food. 
There is a T.V that's always turned to some sport channel or the news; watch it.
 Do not try to change the channel or ask to have the volume turned up. Just watch it. 
 When your food comes, you will eventually tune out everything and not even notice the T.V so why bother making any adjustments?

 It's a messy ordeal, these chicken wings and hamburgers!  Expect to eat like a man. No, not like Kim Kardashian for Carl's Jr.  but more like Conan the Barbarian for Buffalo Burgers! 
Take BIG bites confidently, chew and taste the meat, let the juices drip everywhere, just go buck-wild!! Stuff your face!!! The rest of the world just becomes a blurry background/white noise because the burger is all you can see, feel, smell and taste.  You can hear yourself pigging out too..and it's not a pretty sound but damnit, who cares!  
You know you've just had a pretty damn good burger when you burped and the taste of your burp makes you want to order a second one to save for later! =)
author: Tu L.

description:
Been coming here ever since it opened some many years ago. Ive tried most menu items but have grown to like the Bacon avocado Burger the best. Hot dogs are also good. The managers and operators are all quite friendly. If the place wasn't any good I wouldn't eat there so often. 

You can order pick up via phone. $8 minimum to pay with card. It is right by the 38 stop. Food usually comes quickly, and is brought to you. You can watch TV.
author: Arjun S.

description: I went here once with someone. Their portions are so big and we got some garlic fries here. It was good and I really enjoyed it. They have other foods on the menu too. I think it's near Walgreens and Ross and at a bus stop in Geary street.
author: Serena Z.

description: Had a buffalo burger here...pretty good, better than regular burgers, better than Nation's...ordered a 9 piece buffalo wings next time n they gave me 12 pieces...tasted great! Addicted to wings now...their original spicy is kinda hot and sour ish, and once in a while I just crave for it and have to come here or the one at Lombard, depending where I am at.
author: Jay L.

description:
I love the leaner meats, so when I see the opportunity to try out a new place that has buffalo, I go for it!

Unfortunately, the buffalo burger I had here was pretty tasteless and dry.  No complaints about the bread used in the burger or the lettuce/tomato etc.. etc.. but also nothing to write home about either.

I also had some onion rings.  They were just ok.  I can't say that I could tell them apart from an onion ring from any fast food joint.

There's a buffalo burger place over in west portal that I can't remember the name of (but it's the only one over there duh..) that I still think of as the #1 destination for a reasonably priced awesome buffalo burger.
author: John S.

description: Onion rings are outstanding, burger pretty good, fries were weak.  Long waits.
author: April M.

description: Honestly the burgers aren't that great. Not bad, but not great. The thing is, they have AWESOME chicken wings. Like seriously they are super tasty. Fuck the burgers bro, order some spicy BBQ chicken wings. DA BOMB.
author: Jason G.

description: Avoid, they lied about garlic fries being garlic fries to save themselves some work and then closed. Sad face. Food otherwise 'was not terrible'.
author: Russell S.

description:
i broke the cardinal rule... 

i went to buffalo BURGER restaurant and ordered a philly cheese steak and buffalo wings. 

i'm the first person to give my girlfriend a hard time for ordering steak at a seafood restaurant... or seafood at a steak restaurant. the other day we went to Himawari (ramen) and we saw this table of 2 order fried rice and we were clowning them so hard. i mean who goes to a hot pot joint and orders chow mein? you get the idea right???

well... i was that guy when i ate at buffalo burger restaurant. so in all fairness... this has nothing to do with burgers... but this review has to do with their poor excuse of food other than burgers that they serve there.

the cheese steak had no flavor, the beef was cut way too thick, and was borderline cold. the garlic fries were cold, soggy, and the garlic was still bitter and sharp/spicy. i asked if i could get another order of fries because mine were cold and soggy and the manager simply said "that's how they come... they're a little soggy from the garlic" so i said "ok, can i get a regular order of fries... extra crispy?" he did that for me at least. 

i don't want to get started on their buffalo wings... what is that SH!T??? is it tumor meat? barely describable and as thick as my index finger (at the widest part). it's hard to get full on some anorexic wings. 

i got to man up and admit i'm a dummy for ordering everything BUT the burger there... but that doesn't make my poor excuse of a meal acceptable. 

i wanted to leave half of my cheese steak there but my girlfriend doesn't like wasting food. so we boxed it and gave it to a homeless guy later. i don't know if i did him a favor though.
author: Brian L.

description:
An awesome hole in the wall place to get onion rings and other snack. I did some research on yelp before going. It has good reviews so i guess i will try it.  Once again, i went after my braces appointment because it was near the place. 

I ordered small cheese steak sandwich and onion rings.  My sis said she wasn't hungry but she wants a bite. Then she started to eat the whole half of the sandwich. I was like WHAT? The cheese steak sandwich is good. The onion rings are even better. THEY ARE THE SIZE OF MY HAND!! Where do they get the onions from?  

Negative: IT'S IN RICHMOND??!

Will definitely go back again. Recommended for onion ring lovers!
author: Lily L.

description: I'm going to say it that this place is a dive. However, it is cheap and the consistency of the food is the same every time I come here. I usually get the 2 piece fish and chips and the fish always seems fresh even though I know that it is frozen. The chips are really potato slices that have been fried and salted. I also like the cheesesteak sandwich and the garlic fries here as well. The man that runs the place is always very friendly and he can recognize you even if you haven't been there in a while.
author: Eric M.

description:
This place is delicious! It's pretty damn cheap, and they have buffalo. And I love me some buffalo. And hamburgers, and fries, and hot wings, and a whole lot of other things that are absolutely terrible for me. At least I don't have to pay much to clog my arteries here! 

The service is quick, and pretty nice, so I must say! I found another spot in the neighbourhood :)
author: Lauren S.

description:
The only thing that prevented me from giving this place five stars was not wanting my personal bias to get in the way too much. The first time I ever came here was when I was 12 (I'm 20 now) and I must say that is is an absolute staple for the Richmond district restaurant scene.

Food wise, this place is exactly what you'd expect. They don't skimp out on their burgers, the flavor is good, and they've got plenty of menu options if you're not in the burger mood. Everything is fresh cooked and prepared quickly enough for you to be in and out in a matter of minutes. My all-time favorite is the fresh fried potato chips. Eat one, and you're hooked for good.

The dining area is a snug fit (But hey if you remember their old location, you know its like a convention center in comparison). The workers are super friendly, and know the faces of their locals. 

Now the prices have gone up some over the years. Not super high, but enough to make you kind of squint your eyes and go "Didnt this used to cost..." Im not sure if they even do the little combo thing they used to have anymore. But overall, this is a hot spot eatery if you're ever looking for an easy lunch on Geary Boulevard.
author: Brandon D.

description:
I love Buffalo Burger. A great asset to the Richmond District.  It is owned by the nicest folks around - Annie/Larry -  (they also own The Royal Ground next door)  The guys who work there are always friendly, the food is good for a buffalo burger place and the price is definitely right

 A couple tips
- call your order in ahead - 10-15 minutes
- get the fries extra well done with a side of buffalo sauce - yum!
author: Noah W.

description: This place is a hit or miss, the wings can be good....but most of the time is just alright. it tends to be dry and needs more sauce. The only thing i feel is good here are the potato chips. Oh one more thing, the guy with a hair bob thing and eye liner who takes your order....depending on his mood he could be nice, but from my experience he seems pissed all the time. So if he's taking your order and he seems rude or he's rushing you just tell yourself the chips are worth it.
author: R S.

description:
The hope was for buffalo meet, but my cheap ass was saddened when I saw that to attain that goal, I had to pay $2 extra.  Alas, I went with the cow in the form of their Ultimate Burger topped with bacon, avocado, cheese and onions on a fresh hoagie roll.  The burger itself was actually worth four stars.

The three star status is because when I walked in, there was a party of little flies buzzing all around the seating area.  Less than appetizing and worth one star at most.  The second reason for the three stars is because I ordered the garlic fries, which could have been amazing, but weren't.  They were soggy and somehow too salty, but needing salt at the same time.  The garlic itself was somehow bitter, pungent and lacking flavor all at the same time.  It was like when you smell a delicious sauce and saliva starts pouring out of your mouth, then you take that long awaited bite and....nothing.  It is the mystery of mind blowing smelly goodness followed by taste bud tears at the lusterless flavor.  Another good way of putting it, for you men especially, would be the foodie's equivalent to blue balls.  

For a quick, fresh burger, it'll work.
author: Tyler B.

description:
I've tried the chicken wings here & they were pretty good! Got the garlic pepper and teriyaki chicken. Also tried the garlic fries & those were really good as well.

I've also ordered the Philly Cheesesteak & that was pretty decent. Not the best, but I'd get it again if I couldn't decide on anything else.

Try their Banana Milkshake!
author: Danika H.

description:
I've been here a couple times and I am hooked on the Turkey burger! :) IT is sooo good, a little pricey for a burger but I think its worth it. I came here with the bf and he got a turkey burger, I ordered a supreme burger aka. philly cheesesteak toppings on a burger. Was not as good as I thought it would be, bf's burger tasted so much better. 
Ever since.. hooked!
author: Lily K.

description:
A very easy-on-the-budget burger place with good selection of 'hand foods'

It's really hard to beat buffalo burger's price.  A bacon avocado burger, fish and chips, 6 wings with 2 canned soda cost $20
Based on value for your money this place deserves a 5 star

The food themselves were good.  Not great since the chips were not crispy and the wings were not juicy but good enough.

On the downside while they do serve your food fast they got our orders wrong.  The bacon avocado burger came avocado-less.  Not a big deal in the grand scheme of things.

The other downside is that the place is pretty small and during dinner time you probably won't get a place to sit.  However, this is probably an excellent place to buy food-to-go.

All in all if you're in the Richmond and craving for tasty, greasy food this is a very good option.
author: Andi H.

description:
Having lived in the Inner Richmond (well...closer to laurel heights) for well over a half a year, I constantly think about what the IR is missing.  For me, what was lacking was good cheap american grub.  By grub, I mean anything that is fried and tossed in a basket.  Enter Buffalo Burger.  Open until 10 every night, including Sundays.

What it is: A dive burger bar with a huge selection of heart-attack.  
What it isn't: Expensive.  Also- not cuisine.  But it's not as though they are pretending to be fine dining.

Things you should try: 

Get some friends and split a 50 rack of wings.  They'll happily split the wings into at least 2 different flavors, and they came w/ all the condiments (ranch/blue).  The spicy wings were excellent and vinegary like a good buffalo sauce should be.  The lemon-pepper were good, but a bit greasy.  At the bulk rate of 50 wings, it comes out to be about 50 cents a wing. 

The garlic fries should come with a warning that you'll be sweating garlic for the next day and a half.  Fries still retain their crisp shell while holding thick clumps of garlic.  A-mazing.

The Philly Cheese Steak is a mess, but the juices from the steak-chop combined with the onions and molten cheese is divine.

I would pass on the Onion Rings.  They were passable, but nothing special and for the price I'd rather get the Garlic Fries every time.    

The best part: you can stuff your face for less than 10 bucks every time and leave hating yourself and checking to see if your gym membership is still in effect.
author: Richard Y.

description: I've been going to this place for over 15 years and watched it grow from one small counter and 3 tables to a nice little restaurant. Annie, the owner, makes the best burger I've had here in town and I do love a good burger. Good meat and friendly service. No gourmet style, just hearty american burger faire.
author: Robin K.

description:
Did you know...

- Depending on the cut of meat, buffalo/bison can be up to 80% leaner than beef?
- Bison meat has 35% less cholesterol than beef?
- Bison meat has 30% more protein than beef?

According to the USDA Handbook, just over 3oz of bison meat has roughly 2.42g fat + 143 calories, while a little over 3oz beef has 9.3g fat + 211 calories.

So with facts like that, I'm practically doing my ass a favor by eating here and ordering up one of the delicious buffalo burgers. In fact, that totally leaves room for cheese, bacon, and mayo. After all, I tell myself, the bison is HEALTHY for me. So I then shove all the homemade potato chips and fries I could possibly want into my mouth and add a soda to my evening.

And you know what? The delusion works. My pants feel LOOSER!
author: Anna S.

description:
Finger Licking Delicious Wings + HDTV Flat Screen  = Ultimate Happiness!!! 

When you don't live with cable, you need to find a place that has sports playing on the screen.  I'm talking about the NBA Semi-Finals 2010!!! 

As soon as my fiancee and I stepped inside this restaurant, we had an instant connection with the manager.  He was glued to the TV while he was working.  This made us even more happier. :D

So, let's cut to the chase on what to order. 

1) Get the 26 wings.
   (Comes with celery & carrot sticks w/ bleu cheese dip)
2) Flavors:  Spicy & Spicy BBQ 
3) Side of garlic fries!!!!!  

Total of great food = About $20

NBA, great food and people is PRICELESS.

Happy Yelping!!! 
And...
Go Lakers!!!
author: Deborah C.

description: I went in here today with my friends for lunch and ordered the 13 pieces for $8.25.  We were only allowed to choose up to 2 flavors so we chose peppered lemon and teriyaki!  The peppered lemon was delish!  The flavors were there and didn't overpower the chicken taste.  On the other hand,  I wasn't that satisfied with the teriyaki wing.  It just didn't suit my tastes.  Not saying it's bad though! I was actually pretty satisfied with the customer service even though it was a long wait for our order to come.  They also gave us an extra wing (totaling up for 14 pieces) which I thought was very generous since I was sharing with my other friend.  I would come here again to try other flavors and also the garlic fries that are so famous!
author: Jenny L.

description:
Generic clean hole in the wall place with a tv on the wall. 

Ok for a quick bite if you're on the go or just real hungry and can't wait. 

There are a lot of things on the menu. It's kind of scary cause the menu is on a giant blue back ground and it reminds me of the 'blue screen' of death when a computer breaks down.

Takes credit cards. Clean restroom. Convenient.
author: Daniqua J.

description:
BOMB WINGS! Flavorful sauce on a juicy wings. The wings are drenched in the sauce like some places. It was fantastic. I got spicy sauce and lemon pepper sauce. The lemon pepper let me down a bit I have to say (minus 1 star).

We also got the fish and chips. The fish was so soft and tasty. The batter was crispy and delicious. Overall the best fish and chips in richmond and sunset. I definitely will come to this place more. It's cheap, good tasting food that is not super greasy or unhealthy. 

Pros:
- Cheap
- Great Spicy Wings
- Great Fish and Chips
- Good Location
- Friendly, Quick Service

Cons: 
- Bad Lemon Pepper Wings
author: Kevin L.

description: I must say these are some of the best onion rings ever! Also the buffalo chicken is good. I have a feeling the food from here is fresh and not left sitting out. The service is usually quick when I have ordered to go. Located on Geary. Highly recommend some onion rings!
author: Austin P.

description: Fries seemed like they'd been frozen for some time and the buffalo patty was fairly low grade meat. Not sure how others are rating it so highly.
author: Brendan M.

description: Having lunch and getting my usual 13 wings with half spicy and extra spicy. This place is one of the few buffalo wings that that I go now. I had the buffalo burger before and it was cool. Their cups are fresh and good but don't get it by yourself. I think you can share with three people.
author: Minh H.

description:
The burger was pretty good, but the patty really wasn't that big, either around or through.  For the price, I figure it lived up to its expectations.

I've cancelled the rest of my weekend's activities, because surely the garlic from the garlic fries will still be coming through my pores over the next 48 hours.  I think it's recommended that you wait at least 72 hours before undertaking strenuous activity or strain after such an attack.

If you're into vinegar-y, extremely tangy buffalo wings, then these are for you.  The best buffalo wings, IMHO, aside from those that come from my own kitchen, are those from Kezar Pub.  Buffalo Burger's wings also have the tiniest amount of meat I've ever seen on restaurant wings.  I guess they don't get them from Costco...
author: Tamar D.

description: We've lived across from this place for a long time. This is our go to take-out when we are hungry & can't figure out what to eat. Wings are my go to, chicken gyro my husband's. But I've had most of the burgers on the menu, all good. We always order pick-up, they always say 10 minutes, & food is always ready on time. For 5 years they have never disappointed.
author: Jessica K.

description: My go to neighborhood spot for some cheap & good burgers! I usually get the regular hamburger, but I replaced it with the Hawaiian chicken sandwich!!!! It's cooked with teriyaki sauce & topped with a slice of pineapple. Every time you bite into that thing, all this juicy goodness comes out lol....It's only $5.25 too, what a steal! Aside from that I can do without the fries since I'm not a fan of their fries, but it's up to you cuz who eats a burger w/o fries right? In this case me.
author: Diane L.

description: This place is not your fancy burger joint. It's all about a high quality buffalo burger that is consistent and tastes great. I would highly recommend their BBQ burger with bacon added and while you're at it don't be shy to try their garlic fries.
author: Damoon M.

description:
It is difficult to ruin a burger, but it is even more difficult to make a burger exceptional.  Buffalo Burger is comfortably burrowed in the middle ground.

I had the mushroom burger with cheese fries, and was starving at the time.  Usually when I am starving, my taste buds are universally accepting of anything edible.  This time, though, after my first bites of the burger and fries, my taste buds were on their guard.  The burger was standard, with the usual dressings of onion, lettuce, and tomato, but the bread was immediately soggy, and the meat's main flavor was salt.  The fries were starchy and limp, drenched in nacho cheese sauce that was more fit for an elementary school fundraiser.

When I evaluate a burger, I deliberate if I could make a product of similar quality to conclude its worth.  The answer to this question for the mushroom burger was a resounding yes.

If I still have time to consider the burger, I compare it to a Carl's Jr. burger and decide which one I would rather have.  Almost immediately, my taste buds pined for a six dollar burger over the one I was currently occupied with.

The burgers are mostly under 5 dollars, making it attractive for a cheap, on-the-go meal, but I would not revisit this place unless I were desperate.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Nice find!  Tiny tables.  I really liked it, my husband thought it was ok as his Philly cheesesteak had too much sauce.  He felt the meat had enough flavor they didn't need to slather so much sauce on it.

The fish and chips IS good!  I just ate the fish inside but it was so moist and tender.  The batter was nice and crisp, but I try to avoid eating too much of it.  The tartar sauce was AWESOME.  The fries is also AWESOME.  I also ordered a teriyaki shrimp with rice plate.  I say don't bother with that.  It's just rice with cabbage, carrots, shrimp all slathered in teriyaki sauce.  

Next time I'd try the buffalo shrimp or something with hot sauce.  

Five stars from me, but probably 3.5 from my husband.  Average four stars - till I return then we'll see.
author: Mrs F.

description:
Pretty good burger for the price.  It's honestly hard to find burger's at a reasonable price these days in SF, and Buffalo Burger does a pretty good job with the pricing.  

That being said, the burgers are also pretty good ,but I don't like how the bun is usually soggy if you order one of the saucy burgers like BBQ, Spicy, or Teriyaki.  The burger tastes fine, and its good with their sauces, but a little too messy that it's hard to handle.
author: Justin L.

description:
I love Fish and Chips and I love to try it at different places. This place has some pretty good Fish and Chips. 

Price- Decent

Time- No wait time place is pretty small though but okay size

Will I come back?- Yes.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Just moved to the Richmond area and have been eyeing this place for weeks.  From the outside this place is average, but the menu is sprawling with options to satisfy everybody.  So one night I decided to order some to-go and I was not disappointed.

Buffalo Cheeseburger, small chips and a Sunkist for like $10 bucks. Burger was delicious! Juicy and flavorful with toppings galore. Chips are so great. Crispy, warm version of a potato chip. A MUST.  Dipping sauces cost extra but ketchup is free. 

I'd definitely return and try the variety of other burgers, buffalo wings and cheese fries.  See you there!

PS: It's open until 10:00 pm every night!
author: Sarah D.

description:
Can I get some clogged arteries on the side? Thanks. Just what I needed.

This place is some artery clogging goodness! Their food is good, service is always friendly, and prices are pretty reasonable. One of my favorite places in the Richmond district!

You gotta try their home made chips. They are delicious! I ordered their 1/2 lb Buffalo shrimp and chips (around $7). SoOo yummy! I love the buffalo dipping sauce. Their burgers are also pretty good...sandwiches...hotdogs...fish n chipps...just try it all and see for yourself!

Thank god I don't live around here. Otherwise, my fatass would be here all the time!
author: B B.

description: Not a bad burger place at all!  Their garlic fries are very tasty, but their burgers could be a bit tastier.  The strange location and cramped-like feeling I had while I was dining turned me off a little bit from this place sadly.  It's actually not so bad ,but the burgers could be juicier.
author: John H.

description: The burgers are good, the fried fish filets though I hear are frozen, are still tasty, and the fries are crunchy.  M and I have both eaten here before, but we were women on a mission this time - to test the repellent effectiveness of their garlic fries.  We're both complete garlic-philes so we thought maybe we had found a place that would outdo Blondie's, right in our own neighborhood, but alas, Blondie's has yet to find a formidable garlic fry opponent.  Because everything else they serve here is pretty decent, they still get a solid 3.5 to 4 stars.
author: Jenn C.

description: i've been coming here for 10+ years now, and i'm sure i will continue to in the distant future! i always get the burgers or the fish and chips. the fish is always served piping hot, and the batter is fried to golden crispy crunchy salty perfection. i prefer the french fries, but the fried chips are really good as well.
author: Sabrina L.

description: This place is great ive been here quite a few times and have never had a bad meal and it's never cost more than $10 a person. There burgers, always tasty and the beef tastes really fresh, there chicken sandwiches are juicy and never dry (which is a far to common problem at many places) and even there gyros are tasty! Plus there garlic fries kick ass! Super garlicky and just the right amount if crunchy. The people that work there are always super friendly and even though they have a little sign that says there a $10 minimum for plastic they've never enforced it if my meal was like $8. Overall a great place to stop for a tasty burger or chicken sandwich or gyros if your in the neighborhood. i cant wait to try there actual "buffalo" burger! next time!
author: Dominique D.

description: Really wanted to like this place since its local, but couldn't.....the quality of the steak meat was really poor.  Grainy, already cook and stored in a huge tub....say no more.  The flavor was 1.25 stars at best.  Maybe we'll give it another go and try something different, but need to let some time pass to get over this recent experience.  Ughhh....
author: J J.

description: If I could give this place a 3.5 I would. The burger was pretty good (the ultimate cheese burger) and the onion rings were good too...but what really made it was the price! You cant beat the prices here. The only reason I gave it a 3.5/4 is because the burger wasnt AMAZING, good, not great. If youre in the area, give it a try tho...especially if youre short on cash
author: Tyler L.

description:
Maybe I had a particularly bad burger here, but it was not satisfying. The bread was low-quality and dry. 

My dad got the fish n' chips; I tried some and those were bomb.com so I guess there are some good things here. I have friends who love this place, so I don't know, maybe I just had bad luck that one time.

Food is cheap though!
author: Trish P.

description: Food is incredibly affordable and delicious! My friends and I went here to grab a bite to eat. We've never eaten at this place before, but we had a great experience. The cashier who took our orders made a mistake on my friend's order, instead of taking the food back in exchange for another one, she just let her keep it and brought her a new fresh cooked meal. I ordered Fish and Chips and it was yummy. The fried battered flour doesn't overpower the Cod Fish because there is still a huge chunk of fish meat (they weren't skimpy giving you the real deal). Will come here again!
author: Clementine D.

description: Fck you buffalo burger!   This place used to be good. Saturday december 22, 2012  I ordered my burger. I got charged for bacon but it was not on my burger. And since i had already gotten home, I wasn't going to go all the way back. Also the burger was soooo effing burnt and dry. Never going back. What the heck happened to this place?
author: quentin l.

description: I like everything on the menu! Although it is a burger restaurant I'm a big fan on their take of a chicken gyro! I gave them a 4 out of 5 because the wait is rather long.
author: Julie F.

description:
I had quite a mix of emotions leading to my tasting the food at Buffalo Burger.  Allow me to elaborate.  

Came in about 4 PM on a Sunday.  Place as nearly full.  Good sign.  I place my order (Ultimate Burger, small fries, large drink = $11).  I notice the cashier is taking her lunch break and having spaghetti.  Bad sign.  I also notice two people have left after barely touching their food.  Also bad sign.  The two guys who ordered before me and start chowing down.  One of them raves about the chips.  Good sign.  So far, 2 good signs, 2 bad signs.  Ohhh, this will be interesting!

Order is ready in about 5 minutes.  I dash home and plop down to enjoy my weekly pig-out feast.  Burger is fantastic - just the right temp, smorgasbord of toppings is neatly in place, avocado is a great touch,  onions are done just right.   Fries are solid.  Soda is refreshing.  

In most books it's only a 4-star, however I really have to place it a step above the other B-Burger joints in the Central Richmond and thus am crowning a 5-star here.  I'm just a little disappointed my next visit will not be filled with such exquisite anticipation.
author: John H.

description:
After our first choice ended up being closed, we came here as an early lunch alternative. In terms of the place, it's okay. Nothing special, but satisfied our hunger.

In terms of the location, its pretty cramped for a seat in, but there are enough spots where it shouldn't be too hard to find a spot to sit if one is looking for it.

As for the food, it was okay. We ordered a avocado burger and a chicken avocado sandwich. Both were decent. The patty on the burger tasted a little like what one would expect from a Burger King Whopper, but the additives like the avocado and mustard did make it stand out positively. The sandwich was also decent. It was a little dry, but still tasted good.

We also ordered a side a fries, which were also so-so. On the plus side, they weren't greasy, but weren't as flavorful as others we have had. An acquired taste perhaps, although to be fair we have had a lot worse.

All in all, the place was decent. Not something we would come back to, but it hit the spot for the hunger craze we had.
author: Sami R.

description:
Mhhh Mhhh Mhhh Finger licking good! 
BBQ Buffalo Cheeseburger! 
Soooo goood!!! very nice staff! 
Always have something good on the tv.
author: Jake R.

description:
When the inner richmond used to be my major stomping ground I would usually come here for a burger and fries. Actually when McKenzies the dive across the street had the old owner Jay. I would ask them to deliver it there too.
I just had a burger and fries here about 2 weeks ago. The burgers and fries are sold separately. I would love it if they had like a burger combo special, but not here. I always opt to get the actual "buffalo burger" and not the regular beef burger. It cost a tiny bit more.

The only eatery that gets more business from me in the richmond is
Wing Lee Bakery at Clement and 6th.
author: Andrew Z.

description:
When I was in high school, this was the place I always went to for burgers. They had a good cook in the back and would make the burgers exactly how they should be made. 

Nowadays its 4 years later and their new cooks are not anywhere close to being at par with what Buffalo Burger used to produce. 3 out of every 5 times my orders come messed up, sometimes I get a burger with just tomatoes, mushrooms, and onions. There was no lettuce or pickles or avocados. I ordered an avocado burger, and I was severely disappointed. 

A 3 star rating because of what Buffalo Burger used to be, and what it is now.
author: Andrew O.

description: Fish and Chips!  I've had the burgers and wings here, but fish and chips are the way to go.  Don't get me wrong, the burgers are good, but trust me, fish and chips.  fish and chips. fish and chips. fish and chips. fish and chips. fish and chips. fish and chips.  Just in case you didn't understand, order the fish and chips.
author: Anthony N.

description:
Quick, Cheap & nice Burgers.  
Nothing else.  

Tip: Ask for extra veggies if you want a "beefier" sandwich.
author: Artnok A.

description: Everything I've eaten here has been quite okay - not great, but very edible.  The burger and sandwich portions are pretty generous, and they prepare orders quickly, making it a good spot to grab a quick lunch or take-out.  It can get a little busy in late afternoon, when school lets out a lot of kids show up.  Otherwise it's usually pretty empty but don't let the empty restaurant mislead you. Worth a try!
author: Heidi M.

description:
Very unexpected!
The garlic fries were pretty damn awesome!
It's hard to find a good veggie burger, but this place definitely had it. 
I was lucky enough to grab the veggie Hawaiian burger. I don't think I exhaled once during my gorge session...
author: John C.

description: Buffalo Burger is my favorite burger joint in the city.  Ultimate burger = A+.  My wife loves the mushroom burger, lemon pepper wings and chips.  Service is fast and friendly.  Family owned, very nice husband and wife team.  Easy parking for pick up - just use the 38 bus stop!  Love this place!  Not for fancy foodies that eat their burgers with a fork and knife, but lovers of good ole greasy American food.
author: David M.

description:
This is stop #1 to recover from a vegan restaurant that my wife took me and the kids to - I'll get to the Buffalo Burger review in just a moment - wtf is with a restaurant that doesn't serve any slain animals?  They also have the nerve to name their entrees things like the 'Grateful', or the 'Enlightened'. Is this so they can charge $17 for a ceasar salad?  Please shoot me.

On 2nd thought, I'd rather die from a good-old American-style heart attack. Enter Buffalo Burger.  I could eat here every day, but I'd like to live to see my kids graduate college, so i only go 2-3 times a week.  I usually get the 9 piece spicy wings, which are fried so hard that they have a crispy kind of shell, and nice and hot.  The fries are great, and they refill their ketchup bottles, so you don't have to shake the bottle for 10 minutes - you get half a bottle in about 0.5 seconds. 

You can get fried oysters, shrimp, scallops, fish, and just about anything that would be fried on a grill.  Also, no pious waittress nodding in approval because you ordered some brown rice sushi disaster.

Big screen LCD TV.  They had a recent renovation - had to make the place bigger because they kick so much ass.

For the temporary pangs of guilt, as well as strategically-placed roughage between your burger and the chicken wings, they give lots of celery and carrots...

Oh, you can get a caesar salad there, they call it the "caesar salad"

You can stuff your face for less than ten bucks.  I'm training my twin sons to prefer deep-frying over all other food preparation methods, and I'm succeeding with my partners at BB.
author: tom p.

description:
This is honestly one of my favorite places in the City, and my absolute favorite Burger place.

Do yourself a favor and get a burger.  My personal favorite is the BBQ burger.  I often add Avocado to it, and it is divine.  The BEST burger for your money that you can find.   $5-6 for a burger twice the size and four times the quality you would get for the same price at any chain (Mc Donalds, BK, Carl's Jr., etc...).

The fries are also really good, but I am usually too full after the burger to fit much else in, and usually end up splitting an order of fried with 1 or 2 other people.

The fish and chips are okay....  The Fish could be better.  The fries are great.

The flat-screen HDTV means I can watch sports while I eat, and the seating along the window, facing out means I can also people-watch with friends as I eat.

I make sure to stop in every time I am home from college.

GO HERE FOR THE BURGERS AND FRIES!
author: Jo R.

description:
Good, juicy, flavorful, and plentiful. I ordered the Ultimate Burger and it was one of the best tasting burgers I've had in a while. 

Long wait though, like 15 minutes for our two burgers to get to us. Guess quality takes time. 

I'd call in advance next time and to go too.
author: Johnny D.

description: Love this place. Have been coming here since before there expansion when it was just a whole in the wall. Food has always been good. Burgers are great, chicken wings are great, and I love the fish.  We will always stop here for a great bite to eat.
author: Michael O.

description:
One of my new favorite places to go in the neighborhood.  The prices are fair for what you get.  Have tried their Buffalo Wings, Burgers and Fries.  So far so good.  I've run into a lot of places in the last few years where I haven't enjoyed my burger.  Something was wrong, either the patty was too loosely packed, the bread wasn't fresh, the meat tasted like a non-burger.  Whatever it's been, something's been slightly off but here I found that the burger tasted very meaty, just the way I like it and it was pretty big and wide and cheaper than alot of other burger places I've been.  

Buffalo Wings are also pretty good and I do get the cravings for some good buffalo wings pretty often now.....  

Thank goodness there's a place pretty close to home...
author: Mark W.

description:
I am always in the mood for a good burger.  My gf, not so much.  Therefore, if I am to make a convincing argument that we should spend our hard earned dollars at a burger joint, it had better be good.  Buffalo Burger is the newest weapon in my arsenal of the "burgers for dinner" argument.

The burgers cost about $4.50 each; fries were $2.50 for regular, $2.95 for garlic.  I got an avocado burger, she got a mushroom bacon burger.  Both were flavorful, juicy and overall very good.  My one complaint would be that the bun kinda started to fall apart (with help from the meat juice).  I managed to scarf all my down, but the gf ate the patty and left half the bun on her plate.

The fries were great, just the way I like them.  Crispy, thick-ish, slightly overdone - not starchy/soggy/ or underdone in anyway.  We got a basket of both regular and garlic.  The garlic had tons of fresh garlic sprinkled over the fries along with a flavoring garlic powder.  We barely touched the regular fries, but they were good too.  One basket of fries would be plenty for at least three people.

The place was small, but there were about five 4-person tables and a counter to eat at.  While this wasn't the best burger I've ever had, it was very respectable and I will definitely return.
author: Thor M.

description: I always come here to get my hang over burger.  Which is not the best place to go when hung over because it's not fast food, but it's worth the wait.  the burgers are big & juicy. The fries are salty& greasy.  Milk shakes are milky & shakey.  They have other stuff on the menu but since this is a burger joint, don't get all crazy and order something else.  Stick with what they do best.  Oh and if you are paying with a card you have to at least spend $10, which it's easy to do.
author: ashley m.

description:
Well considering I live only 2 blocks away, this place sees my face all too often when I am craving the grease soaked food to replace the alcohol in my system from the night before. 

The food is exactly what you would think it is. The burgers are juicy and the wings are small but tasty. They do make these homemade chips which are not my favorite (sliced potatoes that are fried), but I would recommend giving them a shot. Onion rings are beer battered to perfection and for about $10 a person you can get the fill that everyone craves after a ridiculous night of drinking.
author: Katie H.

description:
If you've ever had even halfway decent buffalo wings, you will be very disappointed after you leave this joint - gross! Out of 9 soggy "spicy" "buffalo wings", I had only ONE drumstick! The rest of them were made up of mostly protruding bones.

The Philly cheesesteak was O.K., somewhere along the lines of being comparable to an elementary school cafeteria lunch.

Not every meal has to be fine dining, but this place completely failed at even the bare necessities of very simple American cuisine. Money, calories, and taste buds wasted...

San Francisco, why is there a shortage of good buffalo wings?
author: Matt D.

description:
I never tire of eating chicken wings and the delicious crispy chicken covered in buffalo sauce from Buffalo Burger always puts a smile on my face.  The wings may be on the smaller side, but I love the fact that they always give you a couple extra.   The BF and I usually get half Mild and half Medium - both are full of flavor and have just the right amount of spice for our tastes.  

If you enjoy the fiery hot spiciness that keeps your tongue burning all night - try the Fire flavor.  I have a friend who absolutely loves this flavor.  Unfortunately I mistakenly tried it once and it was the worst chicken wing experience I have ever had....seriously try at your own risk and keep a large glass of milk handy.

To accompany the wings, garlic fries are a must and the ones here are out of this world.  They are covered in garlic and just carrying them home from the restaurant to my house, the strong garlic smell permeates the air and the apartment.  It's so worth it.
author: Katherine C.

description:
Whenever I'm in the mood for a good sized burger that hits the spot, I always go here.  Good portions.  Good meat.  My favorite is the Bacon Avocado burger with a side of fries.  

The place has tv's usually showing sports in case you are running out for food and don't want to miss the game.
author: Eric R.

description:
So far I have enjoyed everything on the menu execpt the chicken wings.  They deep fry them and then cover in sauce, a bit too greasy for my taste.  

Try the home-made chips.  They are outstanding.
author: Jason H.

description:
9 Buffalo wings = good
Cheeseburger = better
Garlic fries = hellsa good!!!!

All of the above for only $14.  How can you beat that!?!?!?  Stop reading this and check it out for yourself!
author: Michelle T.

description:
For everyone who raved about the burgers here: COSTCO. Look it up. They have these frozen patty things... SAME. Buns, too. The burgers are edible -- It's hard to get essentially pre-made food wrong.

$13 for a mushroom swiss burger, 9 wings, and a Sobe. Yeah, I'll pass. Eat here only if you happen to be walking around the Richmond and your date suddenly says s/he will cut off one of your appendages if s/he doesn't have cheap red meat immediately. Otherwise, go for Asian -- you're in the Richmond, hello.

Oh, and the place is tiny, there's no ventilation, so it's smoky from the grill, and you're served your burger on a piece of paper in a red plastic tray. For those who gave this place five stars: what is upscale? In-N-Out?

If you're going to go somewhere better than a fast food franchise for burgers, get a real one with handmade marinated patties and handmade bread. My loud vote is for Chez Maman.
author: Perci N.

description:
This place was so great!

We've been searching for a good burger and this place is the best in the Richmond we've found above fast food and below gourmet at a nice restaurant. 

The meat is delicious - tons of flavor and juicy. I got the bacon avocado burger and it was nothing below superb. We also got the garlic fries and they're crispy, hot, and the best amount of greasy,and they DO NOT skimp on the garlic. Fast service, clean restaurant, and tons of options. Will definitely be going back!
author: Sam T.

description:
Trust me.. I wanted to love Buffalo Burger like I wanted to be a fan of Ashlee Simpson. Her songs sucked so bad I really wanted to buy her albums so i could play them over and over to any my friends. But she did this retarded Leno interview and I couldn't listen to that crap for a million dollars. That's how I feel about Buffalo Burger... except if you have a million dollars I might go back. 

This place is damn small. You can walk past it as I've done for a year without noticing it. It's about 5 yards wide... so it's cramped inside. The chairs are all rickety and the tables look like they were found off the street. Smoke from grill fills the small place quick. I've never seen more a couple of customers in there at one time. Yeah this seemed like my type of ghetto place that reminds me of home. 

I got the ultimate burger and had them double it. I need a big burger and this was the only way I was going to get. The cook told me I wouldn't be able to finish it so I added a large order of fries and a diet coke. He laughed and I figured the more the merrier. 

So i sat down on my broken down chair and took a bite. The burger was ok but  I didn't find anything special with it. The fries were the worst. They looked more like thick potato chips.. hand cut with skin on.. and they tasted really stale. Ugh. I'm a big eater but I didn't want to finish my meal because it wasn't very good. But I did anyways to give the cook a good laugh. 

So less than average food in a restaurant with bad decor.. Normally I'd give that one or two stars. But it's a hamburger joint in Richmond so you have to give it props. But the decor.. that's what I like. I wouldn't go on a first date here..but broken down tables, smoke from the grill..empty and it's near my house. it's a perfect place to break up with a girl. Feel free to give me a high five when you see a guy at a table consoling a crying Ashlee Simpson. Why don't you go La La that!
author: Dan T.

description:
$5 to $7 dollar burgers in the richmond 'hood.....dishing up burgers, wings, chicken sandwiches and fried anything.....fried fish...fried scallops...fried zucchini, fried steak fries, fried fried fried~!....a true hole-in-the-wall grease joint.....

bacon mushroom burger...(buffalo burger for $0.85 extra.....).....1/3 lb. of buffalo....grilled medium-well...slightly dryer..less greasy than a standard beef burger....served up on a large bun....not much bacon..but crispy....bit of sauteed mushrooms for flavor....the whole construction fell a bit short...home grilled bbq burger feel...nothing spectacular....

burger with fries and soda will run about $9....
author: Hen A.

description:
I can't think of what more I could look for in a burger place.

My buddies and I went here after the ballgame, walked in 5 minutes before the place closed, and instead of being treated as unwanted - cause I know how it is when someone walks in right when you're trying to close - the guy behind the counter struck up some conversation with us after our order, which is always nice.

Speaking of the order, hot damn, buffalo meat is pretty epic as far as tasty carcass goes.  Price was solid.

So my buddies and I get our stuff to go, leave the place, walk across the Geary and then across 17th to wait for the bus.  As we're waiting, eating our burgers, the guy runs out of the store, across Geary on a red light, and then across 17th to give my buddy avocado he forgot to put on the burger.  

Seriously, the place is closing and we're the drunk assholes coming in at the bell to score food, and this guy still has the consummate restaurant professionalism to run through traffic to ensure that our burger order has been served to us as we placed it.  Outstanding.

There was no way I couldn't yelp that.
author: Matt R.

description:
Really friendly staff! The people running this place know what customer service is all about. I really liked the spicy chicken sandwich. This place is great when you are in the mood to GREASE yourself up.
