I had the buffalo shrimp (battered, deep fried), I ordered them with fries (the staff gave me the house chips on the house as well), and potato salad, nothing close to a healthy lunch... but it did hit the spot. The only thing I would change is the size of the shrimp. The meal would have been so much more tasty if they were bigger instead of the tiny little guys. 

Great for fast food and cheap, greasy eats.
author: Rada I.

description: I must have picked the wrong day to eat here. I came away unimpressed. I ordered the ultimate burger on a sesame bun, philly cheesesteak and small garlic fries. The "ultimate" burger (which comes with avocado, bacon, 3 cheeses and grilled onions) actually tasted bland and the meat was overcooked. The philly cheesesteak and garlic fries were ok. Just okay; nothing to get excited about. Bottom line, you get what you pay for. Also don't expect service with a smile. Lastly I wanted to note that instead of napkins they provide household roll towels???
author: Andyt T.

description:
Awesome burger place in the Richmond district.

This used to be a hole in the wall burger joint but now they have finally bought the space next door to expand the restaurant. Great new remodeled place but classic buffalo burger delicious grub. I highly recommend the hot link sandwich or a mushroom burger with swiss. You could get fries but why get fries when you can try their homemade chips. They are soooooo goood. Great prices as well and it will definitly fill you up.
author: David W.

description:
The East Bay was so hot I decided to wear flip-flops and shorts, thinking it would be nice and hot in the City.   But NO, I forgot, it's the City.  So to remind me that there was sun some place other than the City, my girlfriend suggested BBQ style burgers from Buffalo Burgers on Geary.  She heard about this place from her food buddy coworker who said the Buffalo wings were "East Coast" style and the fresh cut chips were kick ass.  So blame him if you don't think so.

After a nice walk over and some frozen toes, we walked into a very small establishment that is Buffalo Burgers.  Nice guy behind the counter with a couple of guys working the grill in the back.  Buffalo Burgers is NOT a loud burger joint with a lot of "character."  Buffalo Burgers is just a simple place with a menu above the counter.

What we ordered:

Avocado Cheeseburger *****
Bacon Cheeseburger ****
Onion Rings ****
Buffalo Wings ***1/2

Out of ***** stars

The burgers were good at this place.  We both thought the charbroiled burgers tasted really good, hot and juicy.  I thought the burger was pretty generous for around $6, and that's not bad in the City.  The onion rings were delicious, crispy and not greasy, but for the price, we wanted more.  The wings matched what we expected for "East Coast" style wings, but again, not the price point we were expecting for what we got.

Overall, I liked the food from Buffalo Burgers.  I wish some items weren't so expensive, but they were still delicious regardless.  In addition, the inbound 38 bus stops right in front of Buffalo Burgers, so it's quite convenient for bus travelers to get here.  I would definitely come back again for their burgers, and try the chips this time.  Buffalo Burgers is a nice place to get a burger.
author: Edmund Y.

description: I love their fish and chips here! The fried fish (cod i believe) was very crispy and moist inside, and the chips were freshly fried. Their malt shakes are also very good because it was not too sweet and was not too watery. Next time I come here I must try the burgers which is what they are know for.
author: Philip T.

description:
On Saturday I visited Buffalo Burger for the first time in 7 or 8 years!  I try to avoid burgers as much as I can, because, well, burgers don't go well with cholesterol medication.

This place was very different than I remembered.  Old dinky chairs and tables gave way to clean, efficient vinyl benches.  The interior looks cheap, just like a neighborhood burger place interior should, but tidy and even inviting.  There are about 8 tables in the whole place.  A plasma TV on the wall was the main attraction.  The patrons, patiently waiting for their burgers to arrive, tried their darnedest to feign interest in the Olympics crew competition.

I don't know why I didn't order the buffalo burger, but I didn't.  I ordered a bacon and mushroom burger with Swiss cheese.  My friend ordered a mushroom burger with no cheese, and we split a basket of fries.  All this, with 2 cans of soda, cost less than $14.  That's really cheap, folks.

It took us a while to get our burger, but it was worth it.  Piled high on top of a slightly toasted bun were fresh veggies, quality Swiss cheese and slightly overcooked bacon.  The burger itself was a bit overcooked, but I suppose I should have asked them to cook it medium.

Overall, good, solid neighborhood place, but I wouldn't go out of my way to get a burger here.  Bullshead at West Portal is a better option: http://www.yelp.com/biz/bullshead-restaurant-san-francisco#hrid:IymS0Yq1JwsF-8OBTqCK4g.
author: Yan G.

description:
I was hanging out with my friend today who lives in the Richmond. As the bus delayed me, we went to the Buffalo Burger Restaurant.

My friend knows I love chicken wings and she reminded me that I ate the wings at there Lombard Street location and enjoyed them.

We decided to get the wings to go, but it was a clean place. More upscale than McDonald's, but not a sit down restaurant with wait staff. The people who worked there seem nice and the order was prepared quickly.

I enjoyed the chicken wings and we also shared a corn dog. So, there food is not exactly health, but it is certainly tasty.
 
If I lived closer, I would certainly go more often. If you are a New Yorker and/or love chicken wings, this is a great place to go. I saw some other dishes that people were eating and they looked good as well.
author: Christopher W.

description:
they close @ 10 pm
i gotta be honest, i am not a fan of the fries.  it is my personal opinion.  the freshness and authenticity are undeniable, but i prefer my fries crunchy airy and crispy, while buffaloes' are potato-y and root veg starchy, you know what i mean?
the burgers and sandies are fine, grilled cheese is a rip off, the wings are hot and vinegary good!  i like that.  this is a great place in the richmond.
they also have other random rice plates, wha?  its all good.
thanks for reading!
author: yayoi s.

description:
I see everyone else giving 4-5 stars but don't worry I loved it, I'm just picky with burgers I don't think they are the best. Came here yesterday straight after work. This place def stands out on Geary from the rest of the other mostly asian restaurants. The place is very small inside but enough room for sitting and it is clean as well. I ordered an Avocado Burger but I think next time I'd try something else. The fries were fresh and the food came at a good time. Big Plus=Prices. Well worth it. Cus I hate how some burger joints try to jip you for a $8 burger. C'mon! ahem** like BurgerJoint =( haha. 

It's so far away from where I usually eat but heyy I love to just drive around the city until I find something. What better way to explore! You'd be surprised to find I've lived here most of my life.
author: Sarina I.

description:
Their burgers are great and they will make onion rings for you even though it's not on the menu if it's not too busy (shhhhh... It's a secret!!)

Is this place still open?  It looked closed. :(
*extremely sad face here*

Update:  I just heard they reopened and they're twice as big!!  Looks like they took over the space next door that was originally taken up by a vegitarian vietnamese sandwhich place  or something like that.  Ironic, don't you think?  :-)
author: Theron L.

description:
I came here because it's soooo close to my house, and I was craving the XXXSpicy buffalo wings (like Original Buffalo Wings on Lombard).  The guy is super friendly and always has a smile on his face everytime I go.

The buffalo wings were not exactly the same, but it was still good enough to satisfy my fatty craving.  The one thing I realllly love are the chips.  They're made out of real potato slices -- which somehow convinces me that they're not as fattening as Lay's potato chips -- and they kinda have a potato-like chewy center.  Sounds gross, but I love it.

It's definitely not a place to sit and hang out, but it's perfect for take-out.
author: Betty W.

description: Craving beef teriyaki with grilled onions? Then come on down to this joint! It's the best in town, I swear! Too bad I ordered a Philly Cheesesteak. How complicated is that? Seriously, why does my cheesesteak taste like teriyaki?
author: BORAMEY H.

description:
I like Buffalo Burger for what it is. A decent burger in a convenient location (a coupla blocks from the BF's house). Sure, it's not the best burger in the city, but it certainly satisfies me when the craving strikes. Lotsa options for customizing your burger. It's filling and tastes good.

Their fries, however, are t3h awesome. Consistently good with their fairly thick cuts, crisp on the exterior, moist on the interior. The wings are pretty darned tasty as well... served with the traditional blue cheese and celery. I have yet to try much else on the menu, for my standard order here always includes a burger.

The service is fast and friendly, we always get our orders to go. Go order a coupla burgers, then walk across the street to get some beer at Rite Aid. What a night in this is!
author: Courtney P.

description:
Pretty good stuff on the menu and since my friend got the veggie sandwhich, (tofu, green bell peppers and cheese) and liked it. It'd say that's an accomplishment. 

The guy taking orders was very nice and friendly. I'd go back since it's in the neighborhood and customer service was good.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
I'm a wing addict.

I love buffalo wings, but only if they're done right. And the wings here are the best.

I judge all wings against these wings.

There's another location in San Bruno on El Camino... Sauce tates the same.

Great chips and my nephew loves the burgers here, he eats every last bite, including all the veggies on the burger. (he's only 8)

I love buffalo wings. If you love buffalo wings, eat here.
author: Anita R.

description:
Yum.

The hamburgers here are so good. The Chicken strips here are even better. But my favorite thing here is the freshly made chips. I tend to go here more often then not just to get a big bag of chips. When they closed down to remodel I went to one of their competitors but dropped them so fast once they reopened. 

The staff is always friendly and quick to get you your food. The place is much bigger then it once was so now there is plenty of space to stay and eat. The prices for the quality of the food are very reasonable and if you are at one of the nearby bars drinking this place is a must if you are hungry and they are open.

There are better hamburgers out there and burger joints that are better but not by much.
author: Patrick B.

description:
The East Bay was so hot I decided to wear flip-flops and shorts, thinking it would be nice and hot in the City.   But NO, I forgot, it's the City.  So to remind me that there was sun some place other than the City, my girlfriend suggested BBQ style burgers from Buffalo Burgers on Geary.  She heard about this place from her food buddy coworker who said the Buffalo wings were "East Coast" style and the fresh cut chips were kick ass.  So blame him if you don't think so.

After a nice walk over and some frozen toes, we walked into a very small establishment that is Buffalo Burgers.  Nice guy behind the counter with a couple of guys working the grill in the back.  Buffalo Burgers is NOT a loud burger joint with a lot of "character."  Buffalo Burgers is just a simple place with a menu above the counter.

What we ordered:

Avocado Cheeseburger *****
Bacon Cheeseburger ****
Onion Rings ****
Buffalo Wings ***1/2

Out of ***** stars

The burgers were good at this place.  We both thought the charbroiled burgers tasted really good, hot and juicy.  I thought the burger was pretty generous for around $6, and that's not bad in the City.  The onion rings were delicious, crispy and not greasy, but for the price, we wanted more.  The wings matched what we expected for "East Coast" style wings, but again, not the price point we were expecting for what we got.

Overall, I liked the food from Buffalo Burgers.  I wish some items weren't so expensive, but they were still delicious regardless.  In addition, the inbound 38 bus stops right in front of Buffalo Burgers, so it's quite convenient for bus travelers to get here.  I would definitely come back again for their burgers, and try the chips this time.  Buffalo Burgers is a nice place to get a burger.
author: Ed Y.

description:
$16.00 = 26 buffalo wings
Allan, Melanie, Furisuko = fun friends
Lakers losing game 1 = woot woot!
My time spent here watching the end of the game and waiting for Allan's tattoo appointment at the oh so swell Picture Machine = Magical!

the wings were sweet for being "spicy" but the folks at the joint make it fun, they make jokes, in their broken english. LAKERS LOST LAST NIGHT!

Game two i am waiting for you!
author: danny e.

description:
Buffalo burger I've never been a big fan of this place, even in my youth it always seemed alright to me.  Anyways I dropped by here a few weeks ago as I need hangover cure and I have to say the food was pretty good my burger was really good, although I think the hangover helped it taste better. Anyways I also tried my friend cheese steak and it was alright really grease and not where as good as the the cheese steak shop. Overall the burgers aren't bad here and the price is firkin cheap compared to Bills. The fries here sucks, but I am snob about my fries, but then again I'm French. 

I was going to give this place a 3 but the food was dam cheap so an extra star for the price.  I guess yelp can say I'm a fan now. Great place to come after a night of drinking.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
I tried the fish and chips here, and it was good. 
I can tell the fish was fresh. The fries were good. 
They give big portions, and I was not able to finish everything. 
I would definitely go back to try the buffalo wings and burgers.
author: Monina C.

description: Came here super hungry and ready to eat a juicy burger, came out full of regret. UGH. Had the mushroom burger, fries, and potato salad. The meat is kind of dry while the sauce from the mushrooms was constantly oozing out of the burger with each bite. Overall a very heavy burger that did not leave me happy. The fries tastes disgusting, every bite tastes like seafood for some reason. Don't get me wrong, I love seafood but not as fries, sorry. And the potato salad was ehh, I had way better. And there was a miscommunication on the size of the a large potato salad. I was not happy with what I got.
author: Linda L.

description:
I love this place. The burgers and fries are so good. And the hot dogs are great too. There is other stuff on the menu, but I've never bother to try any of it, because I love the burgers so much.
Wait, that's not true. I ordered a salad once, and it was pretty dreadful. But I can forgive that because the burgers are so great.
author: Kristen H.

description: Great burger joint, food can take a bit longer than you would want. For the price the value is there. Burgers use a sesame bun and the meat portion is perfect. Fries are excellent but need salt. They have a bunch of other things on the menu like fried fish and cheesesteaks. Seating is limited.
author: Joel D.

description:
It's a sunday afternoon (or morning) and you have a hankering for a drink. You're in the Richmond, where do you go? The Nags Head of course. Which is a different place during the day than night. Especially if you enjoy talking and smoking with 80 year old vets. Now this isn't a review for Nags, however a little known secret is that BB loves Nags so much, they deliver to us across the street. 

I don't even have to move my drunk ass away from the bar and the TV (Food network + History channel only in the off season) while tasty burgers, wings & fish & chips (note: order fish & fries! fish & fries! or else, you will quite literally get Chips) I have made that mistake before, and nothing is worse than a sad drunk. Also, if you forget a condiment, they keep everything behind the bar. 

The wings have the best sauce I've had in town. Ever.
author: Jasmine B.

description:
4 words: garlic. cheese. fries.  HEAVEN!!

i bartend across the street, so i`m a regular when it comes to ordering at buffalo burger. everything is AWES0MEE here!  the fish and chips are one of the best i`ve ever had.  you get these big thick slices of fish, which are crispy on the outside, moist and juicy on the inside.  the burgers are big and juicy, topped with all the fixings [lettuce, tomato, pickles, red onions, etc.].  the wings are really tasty as well, but they`re small.  oh, and i love the fact that they`ll deliver to local businesses.

the garlic cheese fries are in a league of it`s own!  crispy fries, tons of aromatic garlic chunks, and ooey gooey cheese!  S0 G00D!!  definitely one of my newest guilty pleasures ;D  even the garlic fries by itself are delicious, better than gordon biersch...blasphemous, i know LoLx

bottom line: you really can`t go wrong ordering food from here, and i intend to keep on ordering ;D
author: Dee W.

description:
EAT AT YOUR OWN RISK! 

I went here a couple of weeks ago and ordered a TON of food to go. While I was waiting; I watched the chefs stick their bare hands in raw chicken and touch prepared foods over and over and over again!!! The straw that broke this camel's back was watching one of the chefs come in off the street, go straight to the kitchen, stick his hand in the bucket of raw chicken and go straight to make someones turkey sandwich. NO ONE EVER....NOT ONCE...WASHED THEIR HANDS!!!! I was watching the ENTIRE time! 

I complained and demanded my money back. Even when I complained; not one chef washed their hands. They just kept on cooking and wiping their NASTY raw chicken hands on their aprons! This place needs to be shut down and fined BIG TIME!!!!
author: Karla F.

description:
The burgers are okay for the cost. The person that called them Costco burgers might be right, but at least it's a real grill and not too bad overall.

The fries rock - real hand-cut fries and potato chips. Come for the fries.

The buffalo wings are fair - and that's what I first came for. I like mine crispy and big - and while they tried to make them crispy, these were small mini wings.

The place is a total hole in the wall, and you would miss it if you didn't pay attention.

Not bad for a quick bite, overall.
author: Jeremy P.

description: When I am too lazy to cook dinner, this is my run to place.  Satisfying burgers and their chips are always fried crisp and never soggy.  I prefer to call my order in and just pick it up (they usually  have it ready in 10-15 mins).  This is a great  little place for a burger (decent prices, too!)  I will be coming here for years to come :)
author: Maggie U.

description:
I stopped by Buffalo Burger yesterday afternoon for a cheap bite to eat. I had their 2 piece fish and chips, and my fiancee had their 1/3 lb buffalo burger. The food came to us hot off the grill, and it was pretty damn tasty. The fish was, well... fried, but the fries were damned good. Over all, the fish and chips were decent for the price. Though next time I would go for the buffalo burger. I had a couple of bites, and it really was good. I've had better burgers, but the price is right, and the location was convenient.

Give it a shot if you're in this part of town. Be warned, however, that the place is t-i-n-y!
author: David H.

description:
Me and my bf stopped by on our way home tonight.

What drew us in was the different selections of the menu- burgers, sandwiches, fish and chips, gyro's, teriyaki bowls, milkshakes etc. and most importantly the cheap prices. We ordered this for $19-

-mozarella sticks
-cheesesteak
-2-piece fish and fries
-1 fountain drink

My bf had the cheesesteak and he enjoyed it. I got the fish and chips and i was happy too.

We left satisfied. If we are in the area again we will probably go, i want to try a shake or a root beer float next time!
author: vanessa g.

description:
A few years back, I was hit with a buffalo wing craving. It was weird. I had never had a buffalo wing craving. I didn't know where to go, since I had never had such an urge. So then, where did I go to to feed this craving? 

Unfortunately - No, not buffalo burger.

I went to TGI Fridays. 

The craving was eased, but had not gone. I needed that firey, vinegary goodness. The tearing of bone and cartilage. Gnawing to get every bit of chicken.

Thus, the search went on for a buffalo wing that would satisfy my new found desire.

Then, it finally hit me. Duh. There is a place called BUFFALO burger 5 mins from my house. DUH.

Anyways, that was a really long way of saying - yes, they have killer buffalo wings AND great burgers. AND it's cheap. A great burger for under five bucks. Can't beat that.

I gave them one extra star then i normally would because they're so very nice there. I am always amazed when there are nice asians... so I always have to make that a highlight. :P
author: Bonnie H.

description: The fiance and I probably frequent this place every other week. We get the old standby...cheddar mushroom burgers. Yum. About 80% of the time they're cooked just right. Only real complaint is that they switched their bread to some sesame type bread. I just want a plain old hamburger bun!
author: Janelle L.

description:
Usually a great lunch spot with really good homemade fries and potato chips.  Their burgers are tasty as well.
I tried their "Philly Cheesesteak" tonight, but it was more like the  cheesesteaks retarded cousin.  They put mayo on it with under cooked onions and the meat was marinated in "?" sauce and not really sliced and diced.  To their credit there was a decent amount of meat on my sandwich.   Being from the Philly area I have very LOW expectations for cheesesteaks in the Bay Area.  I would never order Mexican Food in Philly.  Hint Hint BB, do not advertise that you specialize in  Philly C-steaks.  
Stick with what you know!
...also call in advance for pick up to avoid annoying locals and high school kids...
author: David A.

description:
I went here looking for a philly cheesesteak sandwich, and what I got was FAR from one. The Cheesesteak Shop cheesesteaks kill this one, as the one served at Buffalo Burger should have been called a "Teriyaki Steak Sandwich" I'm guessing the meat is the same meat they use on the rice bowls, it tasted like teriyaki sauce!! Bleghh!

Besides the meat my other gripe is that it came standard with mushrooms. I'm of the school of thought that cheesesteaks should not include them, but shrooms be an additional topping available upon request.

I will not be back anytime soon
author: Kevin R.

description: Great burger joint. Always fresh, the buns are amazing, and the homemade chips push it over the edge. If you're a SF native and you have not eaten here....SLAP YOURSELF!
author: Peter C.

description: I've already been here twice this week! Sooo good..I've had the chicken cheesesteak and the crispy chicken sub..oh..my...SO FRIKIN GOOD! My husband raved about his burger with avocado both times. Very wallet-friendly as well. All ingredients are so fresh and the garlic fries were amazing. I wasn't a huge fan of the potato chip fry things, they were too thin for my taste.
author: Dana S.

description: Got a regular cheeseburger (buffalo meat is $.85 extra) and fries.  Burger was good, but nothing special.  The thick fries had that interesting chewy/crunchy combo going similar to Big Mouth Burger in Mission and were very enjoyable.  Asked for a cup of water the guy forgot to give me, and then gave me this tiny cup like at a water cooler.  Cramped place, but enough seating at lunch on a Saturday.  Bathroom in the back room was clean.  Good selection of items on the menu;  I'd go back again to try some of them.
author: Marc S.

description:
These are my favorite burgers.  I had heard about it from my roommate when I first moved to the Richmond after asking her where a good place to eat on Geary was.

The burgers are juicy, thick, and so flavorful!  
I need to come back more - I've only eaten here a few times  - but every time is as good as the last.  

They remodeled it not long ago, so now it's a nicer place to eat in, though I normally take mine to go.

The pricing is completely valid -- I would probably even pay more.

You do wait a little while for your burger.  I can be impatient when I get hungry, but I don't mind at all waiting for it!!  I just order, walk around, go to blockbuster or whatever, and come back.  

Also, if you're interested in actual buffalo burgers, you can get them here!  I heard they're tasty!

BUFFALO BURGER 4 LIFE!
author: Liz C.

description: Hi...I'm Katy and I'm a converted pescetarian. ...it happened here at this Burger joint where my craving for a cheese Burger was lifted...juicy.yummy.beautiful Burger.
author: Katy A.

description:
for a place that's named buffalo burger, you'd either expect them to have either great buffalo wings or great burgers or both. or great buffalo burgers i guess. i came here craving wings. but also ordered a philly cheesesteak and garlic fries. the wings were delicious in the spicy bbq flavor sauce. the cheesesteak was not very good--the beef was sliced too thickly and was a bit chewy. the garlic fries were delicious and garlicky and you get a good amount for $2. everything was pretty fairly priced.

maybe next time I'll try a burger with the wings. i'd come here again next time I'm in the richmond and want chicken wings.
author: Jessie C.

description:
ive officially been wasting money elsewhere.. this is where its at. its up there with bills place as tie for first in burger dept out here in the aves.. both are totally different but equally spot on.(Buff's is fired/Bill's is griddled). 
hand cut potato chips and buffalo burger no cheese everything on it.. im going back today. and probably tomorrow. wings are next and everything else. no beer though. drop the sprites and get some man sodas.
author: aidan m.

description:
Tried their regular burger, tasted like a standard burger.  No frills.  

At least it didn't taste like microwaved costco, like some other places.
author: Dong T.

description:
**Burger review only folks**
Overall: The burger was good and very reasonable at $6.15 for the burger and a soda. I would say that it was nothing overwhelming, but it was tastey and cheaper than Bills down the way. The burger patty was a little thinner than optimal, but they tried to get the burger to medium rare as requested; almost. If you were to come back and get the combo (with fries order crisy) you would not feel cheated at all. Over the In-N-Out line? No.  But tasty. 6.5/10 

Burger: Quarter inch, thinner than I like. Much more medium than medium rare. 
Bun: Typical white bun, but grilled (Nice Touch)
Toppings: The cheddar didn't have the bite of a gourmet place, but their grilled onions were good.
Sides: No fries this time, but they are steak fries and quite good if ordered crispy.
Sidenote: I had a revelation about this whole burger list process as I was chowing down to my Buffalo Burger Burger... Cue Revelation: There are quickly developing two classes of burger on my list; the larger than 1/4 inch patty, and not. This is important as it is nearly impossible to cook a 1/4" patty to perfectly medium rare... And thus the division line above and below In-N-Out on my list.
author: Matt C.

description: I'm having a hard time giving this place a good review, but it's my first time. Strictly speaking about taste, my spicy buffalo burger and garlic fries seemed like they had the right ingredients, but it's hard to make a good determination when the food shows up cold. Obviously my burger and fries sat somewhere for awhile before I received it. Sorry, that's a pet pieve of  mine. I order hot food. I expect hot food. Besides that, the fries tasted stale. Not sure if that's because they weren't hot, but it just seemed like they weren't made fresh, as if the whole garlic fries mixture was pre-cooked. Anyway, if they had given me the food hot, temperature-wise, things probably would have been different.
author: Rich M.

description:
Consistent and delicious burgers. 

Burgers are always juicy, meat tastes fresh, and bun is always toasted. Fries are always done well - plus you can request them to be well done if you want them extra crispy. 

Fish and chips are also wonderful. The fish has a tasty, crispy batter and the size of the fish piece is generous. 

Prices are also great making this our regular/quick burger joint.
author: Lily H.

description: Man, what the hell are people thinking giving this place such high reviews?!?  I came here after a session at the gym with a buddy because I was craving for wings like some crack addict.  I ordered the lemon pepper and my friend ordered the spicy BBQ.  The lemon pepper had way too much lemon and less pepper.  Veg sticks were too thick, and sauce didn't have even distribution.  They just dumped the sauce on it.  Seemed like there was no care into cooking the wings, just cook the chicken, dump sauce and take it to the table.  At least the fries are decent, but if you can't even make a decent french fry, you don't belong in food service.  I should school the cooks on how to sauce wings.
author: A L.

description:
Unfortunately small but delicious and cheap.  I highly recommend their buffalo burger.  The 'mom and pop' that run the joint are friendly folks.  If you're worried about the slow painful death that is BSE but can't give up your burgers, this place is your answer.

Here's some pics and menu details: http://www.inetours.com/Pages/Dining_Archive/Buffalo.html
author: Eric X.

description: Great place and I will go back.  Awesome chili cheese fries and yummy turkey burger.
author: Julia G.

description: Stumbled in here on a sunny Geary Blvd. walk - great price and tasty, fresh ingredients but nothing worthy of coming back frequently.
author: Bao N.

description: Great prices for wonderful burgers. It's a small place but I ordered a Medium Rare Swiss Cheese Burger with Mushrooms and it tasted great. Service was good and we got our food quickly. The burgers are big but they could work on they appetizer portions. Aside from that I'm really happy with this place.
author: Jaden M.

description:
I like this place. Great burgers. If you want to eat a real tasty burger and pay less, you should visit this place. French Fries is amazing! Sometimes I want to eat just french fries, and I always go there to fulfill my desires, hahah.
Costumer Service is good, people are very friendly!
I recommend!
author: Jenna F.

description:
I love it here. The remodeling looks great, the food is delicious, and every time I'm just sitting around, I crave their CHIPS so bad. Their portions are super generous. A large bag was seriously enough to fill up me and my two cousins (they had burgers, but I didn't) and I think it was only a few bucks. 

On top of that, their burgers don't disappoint either. I think I had one a few months ago, but I remember it being particularly tasty. It's a great, small establishment and I'd go there time and time again, both for their burgers and for their chips.

For those who are unaware, their chips are basically thinly sliced potato that is then fried. So it's like giant potato chips actually made from real potato. I swear it is the most delicious thing I have ever eaten haha.
author: Janet W.

description:
I miss this place ever since I moved out of the Richmond district. I've been here plenty of times and have seen it outlast its neighboring store (now part of Buffalo Burger) time and again. The burgers are a knock-out (plenty to choose from) and fries are thick and meaty! I've also ordered their buffalo shrimp and fish, both of which are pricy, but good. The Chilli Cheese Fries is always a winner and I felt like their portions grew bigger ever since they expanded. 

Now with the extra room, it's an awesome place to sit and eat instead of cramping in the corner of the store. The best burger joint on Geary Blvd, hands down!
author: Jeremy L.

description: I've lived in the neighborhood a few years ago and used to go to this place when it was just a little tiny hole-in-the-wall.  Now it's a bigger hole-in-the-wall.  They have the same menu now as they did then. Let me tell you, I love this place!  Burgers are always big and tasty, and the fries are cooked perfectly!  The gyro and fish burgers are good, too.  Even after all these years, there are still a few items I have yet to try.  Next time, I'll try the wings.  Every now and then, I make a special trip to go to the Outer Richmond just to go to this place.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
I gave them another chance.

The fact that everything takes a loonnnggg time to cook is still really frustrating, but the food is good. I'll probably keep coming back because it's convenient. But I usually order, take a 15 minute walk, and come back for the food.
author: jared c.

description: This place is actually bomb...better then the average grub spot...big sloppy Philly for $5...good patty melt...solid menu...I'll go back
author: Christian S.

description: I came here on a whim.  I always walk by and was craving a burger, so I decided to finally stop in.  I got a bleu cheese burger, but I thought it was going to be cheesier.  It was pretty satisfying though.  I also got some garlic fries and they were delicious.  The girl who works here is adorable and super nice.  I would definitely come back and order another burger because it's closer to my apartment than In n Out.
author: k h.

description: Great neighborhood joint. Bought hawaiian burger and 2piece fish/chips. This place aint fancy but its real easy on the wallet, and perfect execution on the food. The burger was a little messy cuz of teriyaki sauce but hey thats what multi- napkins and soap and water is for eh? Yeah TV on the wall. Sports was on. If I was standing there at the bus stop I'd be tempted.
author: Joe R.

description:
Best Fish and Chips ever.  Even though they are frozen and prebreaded, they are fucking awesome!  The fries are good, too, usually.  Hit or miss on those, though, as they cut them there, and I don't know if they preblanch them once before frying them.  i hope so.

Anyways, this place rocks.  Check it out.   And don't waste your time on the burgers, just get the fish, yo.
author: Alex T.

description: Forget about Custom Burger, Burger Joynt, Urbun Burger, and all those other kitschy burger places in the city. Forget about In-N-Out Burger, although considering that they're a chain they're actually pretty awesome. Buffalo Burger is, hands down, the best burger place I've been to in the city thus far. Their burgers are huge and delicious, their fries are perfect, and their prices are unbelievably low. I highly recommend the teriyaki burger, although you may want to split it with someone (it's that big), and you'll definitely be washing your hands afterward.
author: Kathleen P.

description:
Came here this past weekend since we didn't know what to eat! Surprisingly I was satisfied. I got the Philly Cheesesteak and my friend got the avacado burger. We also ordered large garlic fries. 

The Philly was not a Philly. The meat was marinated in some sort of teriyaki type sauce!  It came with onions and a bit of mushrooms. It wasn't what I expected but it was still good. So don't expect a great Cheesesteak from this place. 

The burger was pretty good. Lot of toppings, hot and fresh.

The fries were not bad at all. They weren't as great as the garlic fries from Giants games, but they were tasty and a large order of fries is wayy too much. Get a small and it will be okay.

The prices were fair and they seem to have a good selection of food. I'll be back to try their fish n chips probably!
author: SF N.

description:
What I ordered: Avacado Burger
Quality : 4/5 stars. Something was missing...ketchup? Too much onions?
Price: 4.95
Wait time: approximately 20 minutes
# of workers: 2
# of messed up orders: 2
# of people waiting for food: 6 before me


Number of orders stolen by the wrong people: 2


Seriously, this lady came in, "mistakenly picked up" somebody's order, sat her ass down and started chomping. Then this other guy came in and did the same damn thing. I felt sorry for the guy at the counter, he was working his tail off switching from cashier work and running to make the food. Grab a seat, you'll be waiting for awhile.
author: tammy m.

description: It's a good burger, that's for sure. The hot wings and the fish and chips are good also. The teriyaki burger is a no go, don't do it. The garlic fries are sent from heaven with love. The place is a burger joint and best enjoyed with a joint. The food is dependable in all sense. It offers a wide variety of burgers and greasy food fare but it also offers up just a nice place to sit and people watch and let ketchup or for you over the tops, avocado drip down your chin. I have gone back time after time and will continue, just make sure you got your Pepcid on hand.
author: Patrick K.

description: Love it!! this is the second time i've eaten there. The first time I had the patty melt and it was meh. This time i had the burger with peppers,onions, and mushrooms. It was great, the burger was well-prepared and the toppings made it pop. What really got me though were the cheese fries and wings. Great stuff, not too expensive, you should try it. Do It
author: Greg H.

description:
Place is good when they get your order right, problem is they never do. 

I called in to place a pick up order and specified that I wanted BUFFALO meat very clearly and it was confirmed that I wanted buffalo meat when I ordered and when I picked up but when I got home I was disappointed to find it was ground beef. This has happened the past 3 times despite how much I verified that I wanted BUFFALO meat.  When I call back in they mumbled incompetently and were absolutely no help. 

Do not go there! 

Unless you plan on eating there so you can have your order fixed when they mess it up, because rest assured they will.
author: Shaylene C.

description: Teryaki Philly Cheesesteak. Let that sink in for a second.
author: Jimmy W.

description:
This place is great. After work, for lunch or "the day after".

Burgers are good, fries are EXCELLENT (maybe the best I've had in SF) and the wings are superb.
author: Theodore C.

description: Been here twice and got the same thing, bleu cheese burger.  Both times made me seriously ill.  Just saying, don't eat burgers here or get them very well-done.
author: Shannon H.

description:
*This review is for their buffalo wings.

OMG!!

I came here for the first time a few years back and ever since, this has been my FAVORITE place to get buffalo wings!!

They are SO good. Takes a while to wait for the wings to get cooked but in my opinion it's worth it! Excellent buffalo sauce with the wings. I usually order about 7-9 wings for myself. You can order them spicy or non-spicy I believe (haven't been here in a while because I live far from here).

I'm surprised no one took a picture of the wings. Guess that gives me more reason to come back soon!

My arteries are sad but my tastebuds are happy =)
author: K P.

description:
Yes, they have Fish and CHips...yes, it is fairly cheap...but they are greasy beyond belief and leave my stomach upset everytime....

Nice place, independent etc...and I;ve only tried the fish and chips...so that's all I can say/.
author: Sir Paul L.

description: Garlic fries were thick and crispy. That's probably the top draw here. Burgers were substantial, with a nice char, and the price is right -- a little less than $5 each for most options. But the service is a bit slow for what you're getting. And unless the wings here are out of this world (and they very well could be), I think this place is probably a little overrated at 4 stars.
author: Brian C.

description:
Great buffalo burger at a very reasonable price ($5.75 sans fries). Wish more places in the city served buffalo meat - nice alternative to turkey or veggie, and still super healthy.

Bonus props for the guy handling my order noticing that I was scrambling to make the arriving 38. He quickly got everything into a carry out bag, enabling me to make the bus.
author: Jason B.

description:
Have tried.... wings (5 stars), burger (4 stars), cheese steak (3.5 stars), Fries (eh).

Wings- Great buffalo sauce, even makes up for small but juicy chicken pieces. I would dip the fries in the sauce to make them better.

Burger- Nice variety of burgers and toppings for a very good price. It may be nothing special, but definitely satisfies. What you picture the burger being is pretty much what you get, nothing more.
Reminds me of making burgers at home, but getting it perfectly right.

Cheese steak- Not worth trying. There is better in the city, for sure. An alright cheese steak, for a good price, but everything doesn't melt together like a cheese steak should.

Fries- First time was terrible, but the second time we tried getting well done fries, much better but still nothing special. Next time, garlic fries.

The variety on the menu makes it perfect for big groups, prices just make it more perfect.
author: Lynn N.

description: What a find! Great burgers and cheese steaks. The onion rings are up there with the best. You get plenty of food for a very reasonable price.
author: Danny M.

description: Ok I can honestly say I LOVE their fresh chips.  I swear this is the only reason why I walk in to this place.  Sure their Philly cheese steaks are good and tasty.  (A wee bit oily but what do you expect when ordering a cheese steak?)   But it's those fresh chips that I dream and drool about!  When you bite into one and it goes CRUNCH! omg - heavenly!...But now that I've read about the buffalo burgers being good from other yelpers - guess I'm going to have to try it!
author: Cris H.

description:
Boy after reading the reviews here i figured why not give buffalo a shot. DOH soo wrong. I've tried this place twice to give it a fair shot. umm no bueno.

Burger - well..... they do the charbroil thing, normally a very tasty way to prepare a burger but it just sat there on the grill being torched, i was like well whatever lets see how it tastes. Like Charcoal. one big briquet of burnt something. It may have been better had it not been drastically overcooked. Toppings on the burger are top notch. Kudos on the red onion.
Corn Dog - perfect golden brown, the batter had the perfect taste, but alas the dog itself was cold. dud.
Chili fries - its hard to mess these up but somehow they did, maybe its the straight from the can chili, and undercooked fries but boy did they blow it.
The CheeseSteak - ok, well as for flavor, umm i tasted grease, onion and pepper. not the greatest and by far doesnt hold a candle to Buster's.  The special sauce they use is a mixture of grease and mayo. lol yeah. good stuff. 
Fries - ok, i guess i was pretty much disappointed in everything here so far. 
Maybe the chicken would be better. But it may be a while before i try again. 
Oh for some reason it takes an unbelievably long time to get your order. Normally not a problem but the anticipation of good tasting food and then having a letdown like that. Something they should work on.
author: Cooper M.

description: It's not the greatest burger I've ever had (really good though), but if you're a burger fan, this is exactly the kind of place you want to have in your neighborhood.  I live right around the corner so I can phone in an order pick it up and be home in 5 minutes.  I love, love, love the french fries.  From reading other reviews, not everyone likes them as much as me... oh well.  Combine the neighborhood convenience, excellent value, tastiness  and friendly enough service and that equals four stars in my book.
author: Steve P.

description: The philly cheese steak  sandwich was delicious. The bread was toasted just right. Inside the sandwich was a lot of steak, cheese, onions, and green bell pepper. As i was eating the sandwich, the insides started to fall off because the sandwich was packed with goodness. I also tried the avacado and bacon burger, which tasty, but not as good as the philly cheese steak.  The burger was huge! I had a hard time eating it. The good thing about the burger as that there was a huge chuck of avacado  (usually other burger joints give very small pieces of avacado) and big piece of bacon. Unfortunately, the lettuce and tomato overpowered the entire burger. I also tried the garlic fries! This place has the best garlic fries. Only 2 dollars for the small size (which was plenty!) The fries where thick and you can actually taste the garlic. I always walk out of the restaurant satisfied and have  garlic breath.
author: Eva L.

description: came here after spending the day at Academy of Science at Golden Gate Park. We drove by to the Richmond District to find some cheap eats.I was craving Piroshkis and actuallu found em,but after that we were still craving more substance.Walked by and looked up at the signage above this establishment.A big red buffalo on the sign. How can we  go wrong in a place like that. Anyways we ordered a  burger,hot dog,salad, and  buffalo wings. Burger was soooo good! and juicy good. Hot dog tasted so beefy good too, and they toasted the buns too, even without asking.I love that little extra. Wings were authentic with a good selection of sauce options to choose from.   Check out this place for sure!
author: ernie s.

description: The Buffalo Breast Chicken Sandwich was pretty forgettable. The fries were great, but the main meal lacked any taste punch. It felt like the cook just didn't care about it. Maybe the burgers here are good, but there are definitely better sandwich joints in the City.
author: Haz O.

description: Nice little burger place. I decided to try a different place besides belly burger and Buffalo burger was it. I have passed it many times on the 38 and always wondered how good it was. So we went last night to try it out and it was worth a little walk. The burgers are HUGE and very filling, as well as what you'd expect a burger to taste like.... We also got the homemade chips that they had there and I must say they were very delicious and I plan on going back as well as getting the chips again... Next time I'm going for the Philly Cheese steak I hear people really like it.
author: James H.

description: This place easily has the best hamburger in the city.  I don't know how they do it.  I highly recommend trying their food.
author: Raphael R.

description:
burger was good. the ultimate is not quite 'ultimate'

nix the garlic fries. they're so garlic-y it no longer tastes like garlic.
author: L P.

description:
Needed a change of pace from my normal lunch foods.  Always passed by this place and my curiosity finally said, Lets do it.  The menu was very extensive and took me a while to decide.  Decided to go with the fish n chips.   Went with the 2 piece order with fries.  Glad I did as the pieces were huge and I could barely finish it all.  Batter was kinda on the heavy side but made up with it with big pieces of fish.  Ample amount of fries, nothing special about them fries.  

Main drawback, and this is going to be common is that it took a long time to get my order.  It's a small place with a small kitchen and everything is cooked when ordered.  I think it's well worth the wait.  The next time I'm there, if there's a line.. I'll just place the order, then go next door for the coffee and be back in 10-15 mins.  I'll do the buffalo burger this time.  It's their namesaket..... has to be good too.
author: Guy W.

description: Tried this place tonight and it was great. Good prices and fresh tasty and not overly salty ingrediants. Got the buffalo burger with avacado and bacon, with all the trimmings and garlic fries and a soda. BF got same burger, bill was under $20! The burger was tasty, lean and didnt feel gross afterwards like when you eat most burgers. It was not dry at all despite it being much leaner than regular beef. The onions, pickles, avacado, lettuce tomato were all really fresh and tasty. The bun could have been thicker but hey less calories! The inside is very clean as well and food came out fast. They even have  a nice flat screen inside, so not sure if they have recently renovated but i was really expecting a hole in the wall, but this one was actually a clean and updated hole in the wall! A must try if in area!
author: Petri Y.

description: awesome 'junk food' place. took the bf on a *hot* date to grab some burgers. the fries are thick and delicious the cheese that came on it tasted nacho-y but good. the buffalo wings (spicy) were probably the best we've had in the city so far and at a good price. he got a cheeseburger, a little squishy and reminded me of a McD's burger *it was fantastic*. and i tried the supreme burger, grilled peppers, onions and everything else, it was w-o-w factor great. couple things my bf didn't like- the lighting, that it was 'order at the counter' style, and a lot of fat little kids were in there. once in a blue moon i think it's good to chow down on a burger and fries :)
author: Abigail W.

description:
sometimes, on a blustery saturday night, all you wanna do is eat artery-clogging food and introduce whatever calories you just burned off at the gym back into your body. and, since i am one for overindulgence, i most certainly don't give a shit. &, lucky for me, i have a wonderful boyfriend who doesn't either :]

this whole-in-the-wall on geary has a tremendous selection of burgers &, as far as the sauces go, a good selection of chicken wings. i kept it classic with a hamburger (hold the ketchup please, ew) & a side of onion rings. my boyfriend kept it classic in his own way, ordering the BBQ burger as well as 6 spicy wings. we sat at the window counter & enjoyed the SF Reader while we waited for our grub.

the onion rings arrived first & were gone within 5 minutes. they were perfect & crispy & oniony & big & yummy. my burger was quite tasty but nothing too extraordinary. i noticed that a fellow yelper posted a photo showing that their hamburger patty was not of adequate size. i didn't have such an experience & my patty was plentiful! my boy seemed to enjoy his BBQ burger but focused more on his wings. i'm not a huge fan of buffalo wings but i gave them a try & they were SPICY. their extra spicy wings must be explosive, i had to down my sprite after just one bite of a spicy wing.

four stars for serving a tasty burger for under $5 in my neighborhood & for the best onion rings i have ever tasted.
author: Lizzy L.

description: Me and my husband visit this place every weekend even though we live 1 hour away from San francisco. We went to about 10 different places in this area and couldn't find anything better. The wings are not fat, they put a lot of sause on it so it tastes very good. Personnel are always friendly and very nice to us. They are always interested in our opinion about wings. and lately they have even started giving us extra wings just because we are regulars. Also, the location is perfect for us. Since we are a russian couple we are able to visit all the russian stores on Geary before we grab some wings.
author: Margaryta M.

description: You know your hormones are surging when all you want out of your weekend is a cheesy turkey burger and a Project Runway marathon. Thank you Bravo and Buffalo Burger.
author: J F.

description: I had a friend who swore by this place but for some odd reason I never wanted to try it.  I'm not sure if it was the name, or the thought of eating buffalo (bleh), or the fact it just looks old and small and needs a paint job. But I finally went in and was shocked by very good and very cheap food here.
author: Starla D.

description: I go here every so often after a comics run from Card & Comic Central up across the street. Its very small but its nice that way i feel. Its hardly crowded so there's no wait for anything. Its an awesome place to get fried EVERYTHING and some pretty sweet burgers too. This is a place you can definitely sit and take your time eating Grade A heart attack food.
author: Jordan A.

description: Buffalo burger is a solid grease and fried joint but not at all gross. The food tastes exactly like you want it too, served grill and fryer hot. All that and the friendly staff make this a great place to help soak up those many PBRs you drank or cater yourself a tv sports event at your house. Wings, fried apps, fish and chips, Philly Cheese Veggie and burgers are all winners. They even make actual chips as a fried potato choice.
author: William R.

description:
Buffalo wings are so easy to make, but plenty of places still find ways to mess them up - too soggy, undercooked, too mild, ranch instead of blue cheese dressing, and once, sauce on the side...the side!

Not so at Buffalo Burger-the wings were crispy, spicy and delicious. No ranch in sight. The fries were pretty good too, but there was one stray potato chip thrown in and it was delicious.
author: Andrew G.

description: Came here on a whim and had their bacon & avocado burger, garlic fries, and a coke. It was pretty darn tasty! The patty was so beefy and yummy and the sesame seed bun was perfectly toasted. Their potatoes are so pretty good too (fries, garlic fries, chips, all kinds). My bf had the philly cheese steak, which was also good, but my burger was effin' awesome!
author: Jane C.

description: My favorite Bay Area burger place because I can get real buffalo burgers (slightly healthier for you and a novelty) and yummy fries for a reasonable price.  It's a good thing I don't live in the neighborhood anymore or else I'd be eating my way through too many buffaloes and feeling slightly guilty about the bisons I adore in Golden Gate Park.
author: Surf R.

description: This time I tried the supreme burger and it was delicious!  This place is an  awesome burger joint!  They do cut/make their own fries too.
author: Jeff H.

description: I love this place! The asian guy that works there looks kinda intimidating, but he's actually a nice guy.  Food here is great! The buffalo wings tastes good....just wish it had more meat on it.
author: Nancy L.

description: Good burgers and fries, fish and chips and buffalo wings. Their potato chips are the reason that I don't go there much. Very addictive and oh so good. You have to get them when they're just out of the fryer. Crisp with a nice texture, not too thin or thick.
author: cyndi L.

description: Wow this is the best chicken sandwich I've ever tried so far in this area. Juicy and perfect seasoning just the way I like it. Oh and cheap! $4.95 I guess it was... no compare with other fast food restaurants. I haven't tried anything else from their menu, but looks like they have a quiet of variety. Maybe next time I go will order a burger and fries!
author: Ricardo C.

description:
Solid burgers. Parking's a bitch.

EDIT: Remodel? Wow. Now more room to sit and they take credit cards. Same menu (I think). So far, same food, too. Stay tuned.
author: Matt G.

description: I love this place.  I live two blocks away and go there all the time.  I've never had a bad meal, the burgers are super fresh, the fries are always hot, fresh, and krispy.   I usually order a side of cole slaw, which they make house-made to order.  The owner is such a nice guy.  Very friendly and professional.
author: Warren M.

description: Buffalo Burger is the quintessential neighborhood burger joint. The burgers are straightforward without the glitz and hit the spot. I ordered a regular burger with sauteed mushrooms. The bun was toasted, the lettuce crisp and the patty grilled just right. I had been initially hankering to try their fried mushrooms and zucchini sticks, which were cooked well- not greasy. The ranch served with them wasn't my favorite, but all in all a good experience. Buffalo Burger is a locally-owned restaurant I will revisit again (ready to try the Spicy Chicken sandwich).
author: Annelies Z.

description: Buffalo Burger is without a doubt one of the best kept secrets in SF. I actually ended up here one day while doing a load of laundry up the street from this place and decided to give it a try. I ordered a veggie burger and a side of potato salad. The burger was excellent and one of the best I've had anywhere. The potato salad was pretty good and though it couldn't possibly compete with my mom's killer potato salad, it was much better than most of the potato salads I've tried at various delis throughout the city. They also are very generous with their portions and their prices are super reasonable. They have a fantastic menu and offer everything from burgers to wings to fish and chips to teryaki bowls and salads. They have numerous different selections of fries so next time I plan on trying one of them. Needless to say, I would definitely recommend it and will be going back real soon.
author: Rabbit B.

description: Despite my previous statements, I decided to give this place another try. I went back and got fish and chips, but this time, got fries instead of chips. Much better.
author: Katie I.

description: I had a chicken burger here once with fries.  Definitely pass on the fries.  They were nasty, like soaked in grease.  The chicken wasn't much better.  The beef or buffalo burgers might be the best bet.
author: Derrick V.

description: A small restaurant that seems to have a local following.  Had their fish and chips, and it was pretty good.  Service was great.
author: Mark D.

description: Oh how this place reminds me of growing up in North Beach.  This restaurant use to be on Union St. between Columbus and Powell.  When I finally fell in love with hot sauce and spicy foods at 9 years old, this place was my haven.  So I found out they moved out to the Richmond district, and I finally stopped by to check it out.  I ordered 26 wings, extra spicy, and got my siblings all a vanilla shake.  When the wings arrived, I took a whiff, my nasal hairs probably all burned off.  My clogged nasal passages suddenly became clear.  I picked up my first wings and sucked the meat off it.  Took a sip of my soda and then, my tongue was on fire.  My lips felt like they plumped up with collagen.  I could barely talk cuz I couldn't move my tongue.  I wanted to eat more, but I had to stop after consuming half.  I was in pain, but oh was it worth it.  I am a hardcore buffalo wings fan and if you love'em too, to stop by and see what you're missing.  They serve burgers, Philly cheese steaks, and typical sides, but I don't care about any of that other stuff.  I felt like a kid again when I was here.  Come and see how much it means to me, cuz you'll dig it.
author: Janice F.

description:
burgers are alright. chili dog/fries, are mediocre. staff is very nice, even if the food takes quite a while. the fries are hit and miss. 

it's close by me though, and the hours extend far enough into the night that i find this place convenient.
author: Darrell L.

description: Good Burgers!  Even better fish and chips!  Ill go back as soon as I scrap together some pocket change!
author: andrew l.

description: The wings are good. And the burgers can be somewhat large. But never leave this place without the chips! It's too good NOT to order! It's greasy, but what delicious food isn't?!
author: Bub B.

description: I hardly eat burgers but tend to crave them once in a while. The mushroom burger with Swiss cheese was flavorful, fresh and big. It took up to 10 min until it was done but totally worth it. I was starving though. Next time I'll try the avocado burger. I would always go back and order everything on the menu. Also, a big plus is the nice staff.
author: MS K.

description: Better than Belly burger.  No salad bar of condiments though.  The wings are ok...bordering on not ok.  Some were kind of small, the sauce was ok and one of them still had a foot attached.  I'm not stranger to chicken feet but not with my buffalo wing/drumstick order.  If you're looking for wings, stick to Hooters.
author: Bruce B.

description: I haven't been back since it has been remodeled, so I'm still under the impression that it looks like an illegal little place. The food, well, it's not cheap but it's better than McDonald's at least.
author: Alex Y.

description: Great, tasty, and authentic buffalo wings! Much better than hooters wings and in the same caliber as the great wings of the infamous San Tung restaurant. Burgers are average, but the garlic steak fries that accompany the burger makes it well worth it. Very affordable prices and great service make this a regular stop for full-filling my chicken wing cravings.
author: John S.

description: Good tofu sandwiches. The fries are fresh and in generous portions. I really like how they remodeled the place.
author: N C.

description: My first stop in was a hit, except the miss on the mushrooms. They forgot to add them. But I'm not holding it against them, everything else was hella good. The fries had enough variety in shape and size  to give me that little in your head chuckle, and since even the thick square ones were cooked throughly, it even cracked a smirk on my face. I'll stop by again for the wings.
author: Matt L.

description: Excellent customer service. Gigantic burgers and if you haven't tried their Buffalo burger, try it. It's moist and wonderful. I think it's even better then a regular old beef patty.  Their Fries are good, but their Chips are way better.  Their super crunchy & salty & delicious. All I can say is I dream of buffalo burgers & chips at night!
author: Claire S.

description:
People, just go spend your money at BELLY BURGERS ( on Geary)..  is so much more tasiy and clean.
This place just does not satisfy me!!
author: Cynthia K.

description:
i really wanted to like this place.  first experienced over a year ago was blah...the wings weren't crunch, the sauce was ok, and it was the smallest wings i've ever seen.  price was ok and the people seemed nice.  but still, when you are hungry for a type of food, you want it to be good!

after over a year, decided to try it again.  too bad nothing has really changed after all this time.  OBW (original buffalo wings) is still the best buffalo wings in the west, just like the originals.
author: Food Is L.

description: The burgers here are pretty good...but what is really tasty are the homemade chips.  Way better than french fries or any other chips you've ever tasted.  If you order a burger it's definitely worth it to call ahead.  This place is a bit of grease pit but hey we all need a grease fix now and then.
author: Cooper's Uncle ..

description: I ordered a mushroom burger. It was okay. It probably would have been better if it had cheese. I like the celery and carrot stick option for the side. I would go here again, if I want to be full. In N Out are still my favorite burgers though.
author: Charlene T.

description:
I like this place. Great burgers. If you want to eat a real tasty burger and pay less, you should visit this place. French Fries are amazing! Sometimes I want to eat just French fries, and I always go there to fill my desires, ha-ha.

Costumer Service is good, people are very friendly!
author: Ron B.

description: I like the food here, but i was surprised by their homeade chips. I heard how good they were by a number of yelpers but i just feel that theyre just ehhhh. but i do love their fish n chips, fries and onion rings. though i was a bit disappointed by the fries it was all good cause i had a pretty  good time hangin here wit some friends, gettin some food before we go skate around.
author: Brian Y.

description: best steak fries-extra crispy and they have great fish and chips!
author: Jesica M.

description:
We have been going to Buffalo Burger for a few years now.  The owner is always friendly and the food is always good. The chicken club is awesome and I always order the buffalo wings to go with it.  Sssssoooo good!  

The fish and chips are great too. The tartar sauce is homemade and is very addictive. I would pass on the ketchup with the fries and ask for extra tartar sauce, you won't regret it.

For prices are relative cheap for what you get.  Better priced than Mel's.
author: apple b.

description: Great burgers, cooked when you order them.  Not much for atmosphere, but still a great place to grab a burger.  Great for those late nights in SF.
author: Luke G.

description: my go-to burger joint in the outer richmond. decent cheeseburger + fries, for $7. can't go wrong.
author: Sam Y.

description: the worker dude doesn't mind having dirty unwiped tables all the time, everytime.  really now???
author: Ethan L.

description: I love this place, good old american food, and the service is ok alas sometime s spotty
author: Leigh McInnis Lee G.

description: Good food at a decent price. Alot to choose from. Clean resturant. nice people. GET THE CHIPS!!!!
author: william w.

description:
this is my go to wing spot in sf.  here's what's good:

- the wings
- the sandwiches (recommend the buffalo breast)
- the fries
- the chips (thin sliced fries, awesome)
- zuchini sticks

just good take out.  dont know why this is hard to find in sf but it is and this place does it well. the owners are super nice and friendly.  love it when i need a break from all the good asian food.
author: shar d.

description: Buffalo Burger has the Best Chicken teriyaki and Garlic Fries In the City! I like to get mine with veggies and my girlfriend prefers no veggies. They  give it to you in a white take out box with Grilled Chicken over steamed rice and mixed veggies. The Cheese sticks are really good my favorite! A guy named Paub runs the place very nice man! He brings your food to your table talks to you from the minute you step foot in the door to the time you leave A+ Great service! Goel is the Master Chief with excellent culinary skills very professional! I witnessed with my own eyes that Goel and the other chiefs wash there hands and are very clean people we have been eating here for years and never had any problems or complains
author: The Food Hunters C.

description: GREAT burgers, friendly service, at good prices.  If you're like me and get in the mood for a good burger, go to Buffalo.  They will not dissapoint.  I ordered the Supreme on the soft roll.  Very tasty!  I will definitely become a regular!!
author: Jason T.

description: I happened across this place over the weekend and, boy, was I pleasantly surprised!  The restaurant is TINY--a true "mom-and-pop, hole-in-the-wall" establishment.  Even if diners squeezed in like sardines, I'd estimate that the restaurant could only accommodate 10 to 12 people at most.  In terms of decor, this place absolutely has nothing to offer.  It is truly a grease pit.  You can just feel the grease that the walls have absorbed over the years.  Needless to say, my expectations were quite low.  I only ordered a cheeseburger (although, reading the previous reviews, I now wish I had ordered some fries or chips).  It was fabulous.  The patty was 1/3 lb. and had a slight gamey flavor (enough to make it interesting, but not enough to make it over-powering).  (I generally don't like things that taste gamey.)  The cheese, which was a slice of American, was nicely melted onto the patty and had a nice, sharp milky/salty finish.  My favorite part, though, was the bun, which was yellow and sesame-seeded.  The texture of the bun was perfect:  it was soft enough to chew (not like a baguette bun or a ciabatta bun, which you have to work on), but firm enough to maintain a nice, spongy texture (not like some breads that crumble when you eat them).  The best part of it all was that my cheeseburger was under $5!  Fabulous price performance.  I'm definitely heading back for some fries and chips.
author: Sophrosyne Y.

description: i've been here only a couple times, and for a place called buffalo burgers for some reason always end up ordering the deep fried seafood, go figure.. anywhoo the thick cut fries, large pieces of fish, oysters, and scallops were enough to keep me coming back.
author: Eric A.

description: yelp lied. they do not deliver. my hopes of burger delivery are shattered. :(
author: Miss Kae O.

description: they can never get anything right, and i agree with the person talking about cosco, how can they screw food up that is already made. dont waste your time. and for those of you that think this place is great, how often do you eat cardboard? you can make this food at home just stop buy the frozen food isle of your local grocery store.
author: daniel a.

description: Great burger.  IT was juicy and grilled to perfection.  You have to know that this looks more like a run-down burger joint.  You can barely fit 10 ppl in there, but their skill with the burgers are excellent.  I cannot say so for the buffalo wings.  They taste pretty awful.  The sauce smelled excellent, and that fools you into taking a bite.  The meat is dry and there is really no taste at all.  The smell is all a LIE.  The fish and chips was ok.  The chips not so great, but the fish was crisp, moist and overall not bad.  We also had an order of the chili cheese fries.  Again, the chili cheese was good, but the fries were a disappointment.  The fries was too try and none of that oily fries taste, so it doesn't even taste like a fry.  I will not apologize for my high expectation of fries.  I think they are really important in a burger/fry meal or fish and chip meal.  I think I'll only come here for the burger.
author: AhLin C.

description: Okay, so, they definitely have the best hot wings in all of SF!!!  I really miss the hot wings from the East coast (just like the bagels as written previously), but they taste almost as good, they of course aren't $ .10 a wing, but they are delicious!!  Their spicy chicken sandwich used t be very good to, but it is slacking off in the past 2 years, sometimes I get one and it is just pieces of chicken, falling apart, to messy.  the other reason why they do not get 5 stars is due to the fact that they don't deliver, why????????
author: J C.

description: All I care about is burgers.  Buffalo Burger's burger tastes bland and is not worth even the low price they charge for it.  It looked like it might have even come from a frozen package, which would explain the extremely long preparation time (over 10 minutes).  Belly Burger is still the best burger in the area.
author: Nick B.

description: yeh i was there with that brian y guy rite below me i have to says hes rite i agree with him bout all the stuff he said
author: justin l.

description: We had the fish and chips and cheesesteak with a side of onion rings.  It was crowded so it took a really long time to get the food and it seemed like the restaurant was unable to handle such a long line.  The fish was good, but the pieces were smaller than your average portion for fish and chips.  The fries were big thick steak fries, which I don't love but my friend liked them fine.  My cheesesteak was NOT a philly cheese steak, but like a terriyaki marinated steak sandwich.  Even though I wanted a cheesesteak, the sandwich tasted pretty good, so in the end, it was fine.  Just don't order the cheesesteak if you're expecting a philly cheesesteak.
author: Grace C.

description: I always eat at the Buffalo Burger when I want a fantastic burger and wonderful French fries. I eat burgers with fries about 4-6 times each year. Buffalo Burger is the only place that I go for burgers and fries. Just thinking about their Ultimate burger with buffalo meat with everything on it and their fries makes my mouth water. As soon as I have placed my order, I ask the cashier to deliver it to the coffee shop/cafe next door, Royal Ground Coffee. Buffalo Burger will deliver your order to the Royal Ground Coffee if you ask. The owner of the Buffalo Burger owns the Royal Ground Coffee, which is a great place in its own right. I walk about 50 feet to the door of the Royal Ground Coffee, order a drink, and sit down at a table. A few minutes later one of the Buffalo Burger employees brings my buffalo burger and fries to my table. The burger and fries are always the perfect temperature. Instead of ketchup, I eat my fries with tartar sauce. The last bite is as superb as the first. If you are a connoisseur of burgers and fries, this is the place to go.
author: Eric P.

description: yum yum yum! this place is awesome! burgers=bomb, homemade chips=bomb, philly cheesesteaks=bomb. can't wait to come back and try the wings!
author: N. M.

description: love this place. i always get the wings. some people might say they are small, but only compared to gigantic hormone injected wings you see at some other places. even if you happen to get an extra tiny wing, they always throw in another one to compensate. good pricing and i love the spicy sauce. the burgers are also fairly priced and the fries and especially chips are pretty good
author: Bobby J.
